Kp1eEaHBmHIdm6jLpMxFYQ.text: Not sure where all the stars come from, but it was just okay. Not bad, not good.

DbytEvnqW7zuyeeOmXIbrQ.text: Best pancakes. Real food, organic and locally grown. Great staff. Can't wait to go back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wuOkpB0wTdIhmjeSMyMo3w.text: Came here based off Yelp reviews while on vacation. My mom and I came on a Sunday morning around 11 and only waited about 10-15 minutes. Our server, Andrea, was very attentive and kept checking on us to make sure we had everything we needed. My mom and I both ordered the chicken apple sausage scramble and it was amazing. It was so much food that I couldn't even finish it. They have a little display window with pastries that you can order (to eat there or to-go). The only slight downfall is that the tables are pretty close together, I could easily heard what the table next to us was talking about, and I'm sure they could hear us. Aside from that, service and price was perfect.

ftgme29NWt12JmEtmzVzyw.text: The Original Breakfast House is an amazing place to eat ! The breakfast is delicious with many selections ! The staff is polite and friendly - I would highly recommend OBH to everyone !

ZuvLbLCPMhQmzvXA1PV3Ew.text: I live in the neighborhood of this restaurant and have been avoiding in due to a string of bad restaurants in place before it.  Additionally, the outside looks like a regular 'ol diner.  I was mistaken!  It's cute inside, almost modern decor with enough 'diner' feel to know you should order breakfast.  On a Saturday morning, my boyf and I strolled in for some eggs and bacon.  It was busy, but we only waited about five minutes.  I ordered an omelette with spinach, bacon and mushroom- it was HUGE and stuffed with ingredients, not just all eggs and a few bits of spinach- I was impressed.  I could only eat half and took the rest home for yummies later.  It came with whole wheat toast (ya! for another option besides 'white') and they have local jam that was super delish!  My boyf ordered the French toast, which gets a lot of attention.  It's lightly fried, and he could not have been happier, as it also came with bacon and two eggs!  I tried the French toast, quite different from your usual soggy bread French toast with great flavor.  Price was reasonable.  Service was attentive and fast.  We will be back and definitely want to try the lunch menu, too!

QTNMwY51E9eg84pJJFQvKQ.text: Family atmosphere. All employees work so well together and provide exceptional service!!!  Pancakes are fantastic!!!!!!  They even OFFERED to-go cups for our coffee. Every meal out should be a experience like this one. Thank you,Nick and crew!  IT'S PANCAKE TIME!!! YEAH!

aBfCfJSbeV49TZgeyDORiQ.text: Food was outstanding along with the service.  Went two mornings in a row when I was in-town, and will go again if it's convenient to me next time I am over that way. My order came promptly and was cooked perfectly. Serving staff was as pleasant and helpful as any you find in the finest restaurants. Their only response to any request was "absolutely." The owner, Jim, was there both mornings I was there and very actively involved.  Watching him in action made it easy to see the reason the place is so outstanding.  It's a direct reflection of him. Pricing was more than fair. Decor was nothing fancy but who cares? I don't know about you, but I'll give good food, outstanding service 5 stars every time.

NXq-wIn9klcirvqyB-sI2Q.text: Pretty good breakfast food. Service has always been great. The environment is in need of updating, but I'm not usually one to care much about that as long as the food and service are good.

w2Oh7GK9wfFfrshgf5cwjw.text: The portions are big. The food is fresh, organic, local, and delicious. They have simple options, and some different ones like the chorizo omelette. Fresh squeezed orange juice was awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Paso omelette with a side of French toast and blueberry pancakes

X5jjUhcU4NJwio8E-qPN-w.text: Food is awesome! The cook their scrambled eggs perfectly, not like most places that overlook. They use real egg for the scrambled eggs, not liquid eggs like most places.  The French toast was great and the service was amazing. Definitely 5 stars.  Note they will be closed July 12 - July 21 for vacation.

JiANvIbRQe3_2_Qb9yjstw.text: Great breakfast! Nice friendly service.Delicious fresh squeezed Oj with free refill. Reasonably priced with large portions. The ham is off the bone real ham Delicious baked goods Will definitely return (probably  tomorrow )

JoVTiBgt1TkDsF_TLlXTtw.text: Only rating the breakfast, as I haven't eaten here for any other meals, but this is one of the best spots in the valley for breakfast.  The French toast is delicious.

m2WZ6c5m7Bb7jkE9-DvCRQ.text: If you're looking for a breakfast/lunch place that is cheap but with delicious food and a lot of variety, this place is it! It does get pretty busy on Sunday mornings but it's worth the wait. Service is good- food is good- price is good. What more could you want?!

_lA3v5zsrS08QXLwd5r2xw.text: Price to the said quality of ingredients was good. My wife and I just left a little under-whelmed.  The food wasn't raw or bad. We just were not as impressed as people have been raving about it. Maybe we went in with higher hopes than we should have.   The place is nice, clean. Friendly staff. The OJ seemed like it was fresh mixed with something else. Maybe it was just me, (i don't really drink fresh OJ that often to be a connoisseur).  I got the big messy breakfast (or something of that similar name). Tiny slices of sausage in it. Nothing to leave me wanting to order this again.   I would come back to order something different off the menu. I feel that they have redemptive quality, but for now 3 stars.

5G73giGwPp0qKC1aA4j6Ng.text: Had breakfast at O.B.H on Monday food is so good, great portions,.and price. I tries the Juans Tacos after another customer had suggested them. Delicious!! Perfect so ice am blend.for.me. I added the French Toast omg we will be back. D-lish!!.

scrNdAYt1vYAzP3OLBSi4A.text: This place is absolutely the best!!! There may be a long wait but it IS DEFINITELY worth it! The staff is always  friendly and the portions are big! The French toast is always to die for!

8aPNdvhoqcISmqN6KzgBog.text: Phenomenal.  Been in Phoenix for the week and on the last day found this place.  Great food and service.

4CHAr33GGeD0SNDhXnjnrg.text: Decent breakfast. Offers quality brekkie basics with a sprinkling of specials for those that are more adventurous. Service was great also - attentive, but not rushed.

1EIZUNH4tUwJ0Jh1fzPEww.text: Oh my GOSH!!! Our first trip here and we will absolutely be back! Ordered the Pancake Special (2 cakes, bacon & eggs), BF had the French Toast Special (2 toasts, sausage & eggs). Wowie zowie!!! The pancakes have lemon in them and they are the fluffiest cakes I have ever eaten! The french toast is deep-fried, has orange & cinnamon in them and they are amazing! We both chose the real Vermont syrup for $1 extra, totally worth it. Oh, and this won the BF over, they have whole milk. Yep. Yummy, syrupy french toast and pancakes and WHOLE MILK.  The bacon is thick and cooked perfectly!! I didn't try the sausage but the BF said they were smokin' good! Last but not least, our server Emily is a complete sweetheart and gave us the lowdown when we first got in. Thank you for making this a great experience!!! We can't wait to come back next weekend for breakfast!!!

mdswaZbCYo6ayiwXUocgyQ.text: This place was unbelievable. Food was phenomenal and excellent portions. The scramblers were great and the servers were all attentive. The coffee was also great. There was a long line on the weekend but service moved quickly.

ZkXqDvgI4OyjTDzxgHw51Q.text: This was my first time visiting the Original Breakfast House, the biggest compliment that I can give is I cant wait to go back and order the French toast topped with strawberries.

t4Vp31MiKWMzcLcfJhwUoQ.text: OMG  If you love cinnamon rolls you must TRY the cinnamon roll pancakes!!! Came up from SF for spring training and after reading a few reviews I was convinced that I had to give this place a try. I'm glad I did because everything was so delicious. From the pancakes to coffee (my bf got the chorizo tacos and those were bomb too). The servers were very tentative and friendly. I will definitely come back next year.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OMG  If you love cinnamon rolls you must TRY these pancakes!!!

sD7wq-BTapgOENj7Ls40hw.text: AMAZING IS ALL I HAVE TO SAY! Amazing food, amazing customer service, amazing pastries, amazing vibe. I loved it. We will be back for sure!

G_9IYaX9JzPqLb06YZSYgA.text: I originally heard about this location from a local television "foodie" show called "check please" The concept of breakfast place from a locally owned business was the main reason of my visit. We all decided to visit for a fathers day brunch. Once you enter the doors you have a west coast beach feel with all the decorative designs of surfboards and VW bus wagons.  I went ahead and ordered scrambled eggs, three strips of bacon, hash browns and two pancakes. Figured this was an appropriate meal since I LOVE breakfast! Have to say the strips of bacon were thicker than most other breakfast locations, so that was a plus! The hash browns were nice and crispy and the pancakes had a deliciously fluffy  combined with the creamy butter and syrup. I also tasted some of the french toast with strawberry, and the bread is thicker than most toast, but the liquids it was mixed with kept it nice and moist! Cannot forget about how strong flavored the black coffee complimented the meals! Overall my whole family thoroughly enjoyed there meals and appreciated the service that our server provided for our big party!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HQ684VsLz35asU_3DUuCug.text: I got the Green chili pork Benedict and the pork was absolutely atrocious with big overcooked chunks with large pieces of fat at the end. The benedict itself was good, great flavoring. My mother got french toast, very heavy and cakey. She said it was just okay. Will not be back especially when there are better alternatives for the same price if not lower such as Butters.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Massive amounts of fat on my green chili pork benedict

Cs9VtczUSAWJZu403YD7lA.text: Breakfast is in the air and on a hot plate!  But seriously, the breakfast atmosphere in this place is magical. The friendly staff, the decore, and the delicious food make this a joyful unique experience. Family friendly amazing food awaits anyone who walks in the door.  The rich history of the owner John is on display and best of all you can taste it!  The 30min wait was well worth it. The portions are big and satisfying, doggy bags preferred. Today's special was Red Velvet Waffles and wow are they good. If they are available to order, take advantage, thank me later. The menu is fast and covers most pallets. We will definitely be back to cover more ground of the menu. Taste as much of the menu as we can, is our plan. Enjoy your visit and I hope your experience is as good as ours was.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot chocolate. Delicious!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and French Toast with Garvey and scrambled eggs!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Specials

R2-vC-iOEACSOqsGDXnOSA.text: Quick service everytime: during the summer weekdays, school days, and anytime basically. No matter how big or small the group is. I have tried many things here and they are all great. Super friendly staff.

3wAc9bfxBlqvj92_l7va7Q.text: The spam and eggs was delicious! My whole family loved their dishes. The French toast, Cali burrito and pancakes were all VERY GOOD. Awesome place! The decor and music is beachy and relaxing, don't be fooled by the exterior. Just FYI, they only take cash but they have a fee-free ATM on the premises. Wish I lived in Phoenix!

1jy4-aqqCGnb_nGN1CZh6w.text: Fantastic coffee! And for breakfast thats exactly what you want!  They added flavor creamor which I found to be 5 star worthy in and of itself.    The breakfast was delicious!  We sat at the counter and the staff were friendly, knowledgeable and kind.   Im not exactly sure what my husband had - I think Chicken and french toast- I was too busy enjoying my food - I paid no attention to his!  I had the 2 eggs, 2 bacon, and 2 pancakes and NO complaints at all. It was a fantastic breakfast and worth every penny.

NcFLK7yWrfsIjRmBnc1AMg.text: Found these guys on Yelp.  Came here for the first time during Spring training 2017.  Now I can't help but visit at least once a month.  I recommend trying the chicken fried chicken and French toast and/or the Chilaquiles.  Get there early as waits can be around 30 minutes (totally worth it) and it is cash only.    They do have a zero fee ATM  within the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0lBlevMlfeMhzhM3i_08hg.text: Where to start, yum! This place is so neat inside. The decor is very fun and the staff is equally as fun. Everyone is happy and upbeat. The food is fantastic! We had breakfast which I would eat over and over again. We all got different plates and shared them. It is a little pricey, $4 for a juice. But worth it for a nice treat!

lDL0D5Dt1J875vWE-PmEPw.text: Great service, good food, try the fresh squeezed orange juice.   Pancakes are delicious and light.   5 stars all the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kmAZ_9QGF8hnjfLV9-kYPQ.text: This is by far one my favorite restaurants for breakfast and lunch!! Excellent food great service and atmosphere!! We take all our out of town guests here!!! Love OBH and John is awesome!!!

dSv8_Pgs_g88b7mq0JWDJA.text: We needed a spot for brunch so when I saw that this place had good reviews we decided to give it a try. The restaurant has limited seating and was really busy. We got seated, ordered, and the food came out in a timely manner. Their orange juice is amazing - freshly squeezed, very pulpy, and you get 1 refill on the house. I had their El Paso omelet which was really good and their pancakes have a slight lemon flavor so they were really refreshing. The family enjoyed their food too and we didnt go home hungry. The only problem I had was that the food was on the pricey side for a diner and they only accept cash. They do have a printed explanation as to why they only accept cash which I can understand but you would think that if they are trying to keep cost down, they wouldnt charge their customers so much for the food. BUT! I appreciate the delicious food and wouldn't be hesitant coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Paso Omelet

MlhEH6Qykek90K69iuJ9rQ.text: Food was good but the eggs tasted like they were cooked on the grill with oil rather than butter. Orange juice was delicious with lots of pulp and tasted as if it was just squeezed. Waffles were fabulous and so so large. They were fried and crispy. Bacon was thick and tasty. Pancake special was definitely a special but an up charge for their special chocolate raspberry pancakes at $3.75 pushed it over the edge. Although breakfast was delicious, it was pricey at $38+ tip for two.  We'd go back but share a meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2WUK_GBVm5Oi4Btlax96sQ.text: The high reviews for this establishment are for the huge portion sizes. The ambiance is island casual / surfer dude type stuff. The food is less than stellar. The hash browns were wet and mushy with no crunchy char. The pancakes contain lemon zest. Why would you want pancakes to taste like lemons? If you want a boatload of mediocre food for breakfast - this is the place. There are way better places for breakfast if you want something more.

AaSrVq5NY9YZ9NGElTtI-w.text: We took a chance and decided to make our first visit on Fathers Day, knowing there wasn't an option for a reservation. We arrived with a party of 3 and waited only about 45 min, which we were fully prepared for. We all agreed that it was well worth the wait. Dad had the chorizo burrito, which he said was amazing and only was able to eat half because it was so big. Little man had the French toast, San Francisco style, which we highly recommend and I had a bacon and egg dish with home fries who h was great. Service was extremely pleasant and our server was nothing short if friendly and happy. We, of course, also split a cinnamon roll, which is a must. We will definitely be back and look forward to it! CoZy, friendly and great food.

LLFwbLevybOPIOtT652R_w.text: My boyfriend LOVES the French toast here! I've never seen fried French toast before it's definitely interesting. I got biscuits and gravy which weren't great but weren't bad either. Service was alright, nothing exceptional..

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k3qRHpmRmA1mIB3qIdqcGQ.text: This is probably one of the best breakfast places in Phoenix. The staff there was very friendly. I got the cinnamon roll pancakes with bacon. It was amazing probably the best pancakes I've had. Also the places is very nice inside they have a lot of surfboards in there because it is like a California diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll Pancakes

PXRja43t560iGf05nHN9Ug.text: This place would be slammed busy if it were in CenPho.  It is a great dinner with lots of yummy things for breakfast and lunch.  My favorite is the breakfast burrito.  btw, Milk Shake Mondays!  $2 all day.  I've not had one yet but they look great.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_I3TDRkEjIFT41czzbUxjg.text: Stopped by here for brunch after hiking Camelback. Didn't have to wait too long even though there was a line out the door. The giant cinnamon rolls look better than they taste. Enjoyed the local vibe. The machaca was prepared differently than I am accustomed to, but it was ok. Nothing blew me away taste wise but the service was great.

JFEY6E3IP3UDi0lzCkyKNg.text: Great food for a decent price. They give you more than you need. Their coffee is good, and they leave the pot at your table! The waitress was awesome, very friendly and on top of her game. Would definitely come back for more!  Deep fried French toast, need I say more?

6-eTK_-hulUaa-Kbk8oVQQ.text: We like the Original Breakfast House so much we drive from Glendale for their breakfast.  They have a comprehensive breakfast menu and serve breakfast until closing and lunch all day.  It is a popular destination so there could be a wait, but once seated and your order placed, your meal arrives promptly.  Check out their specials on the board behind the counter.  We think you will like this family run establishment. Give it a try. What do you have to lose?  We are sure you will come back time and again like us.

xLy1gFWte9yZR9S3NyYybA.text: It's simply the best. Food is always consistent, always served quickly and always delicious! We eat breakfast there every day while visiting Phoenix. If you like fence toast, they have the best!

q3OdyJDcd4RrrkcUjoD-PA.text: My husband and I happened to be in Phoenix and looking for Sunday breakfast and found this wonderful place. At 10 am on a Sunday they quoted a 20 minute wait,  and it was just that (that is very resonable). I do love coffee and for $2.50 you get a never ending carafe...no vanilla or hazelnut creamers, just  half and half, but the coffee is worth it. I rarely drink more than 1 cup, but had 3.  Excellent diner drip coffee!    Yes, the OJ is fresh and you get a free refill, but it IS massive orange pulp, my husband spit out 2 seeds.  Still,  the FLAVOR  is wonderful!   On to the food!   I had the El Paso Omelette,  omitted the chorizo and asked for bacon!  My husband had the San Francisco French toast, triple berry special.   Mine was 3 fluffy eggs in an omelette with God knows how many pieces of crispy, smoky crumbled bacon, that substituted the chorizo... succulent onions,  medium spicy green chiles, tender tomatoes, wonderful savory black beans and melted cheddar cheese! Along  with the home fries that were so savory and flavorful.   They reminded me of what was served from my grandmother's cast iron skillet! Plus instead of toast, got 2 fluffy, light pancakes, scented with lemon zest.  It's a very unassuming flavor, but citrus is designed to clean the palate so you can eat more without feeling so full!   Not a bad thing!    My husband's San Francisco French toast,  on sourdough and then deep fried to give that final crunch, was incredible.  And with the 3 berries (strawberry, blueberry,  blackberry) and hot  maple syrup made it a special, but not TOO sweet combo. Plus 2 over medium perfect eggs and 2 slices of exceptional crispy bacon!   We don't often get to Phoenix, but always have Sunday breakfast.  It was $33.00 plus tip, a little more for breakfast, but for what we got,  it was well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El Paso omlette, sub bacon for chorizo, with home fries!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Triple berry San Francisco French Toast

gMRgvMIde1WeKlCOOqwyrA.text: Ive been here before with my girlfriend and being here is always refreshing and they have great variety of breakfast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken steak, scrambled eggs, hash browns

zWOG5EISgRIkE3SkSLU40g.text: Love this place. Lots of great breakfast places in the Valley and i have eaten at them all. In my opinion, this is the best ones. My 2 personal favorites: anything with chorizo and their pancakes. Their French toast is also amazing but too rich for me. My kids have the metabolism to eat that.

n-0yFbJB7w1qVANXTvi75Q.text: I love this place! Delicious food, friendly staff, and a community feeling. Happy to have a gem like this in the neighborhood.

Ei0J2iVkxMbfnWtA40DU5Q.text: As always the food here was great, service is fast and friendly and the place clean and inviting. My favorite part about this place is, they leave the coffee container at the table. My least favorite part, and this is just a personal preference and in no way changes my positive review, they put a little orange zest in the pancakes. PS... the coffee is amazing. Try this place out, you won't wait long and you will be full and happy when you leave.

zxysnX6vUfFDU1h9NIgLxg.text: 5 star meal for a 3 star price! Excellent food! French toast is to die for, the granola is fantastic, and the fresh squeezed orange juice and the hot chocolate are both amazing. Had to wait a few minutes for a seat, but our waitress was super sweet and attentive. The portions are huge though! Wish I had shared with a family member, we had a ton of leftovers. If I lived here I would come here all the time. The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable, kind of a cross between a little diner and your local ihop. Love this place! Really is the best breakfast restaurant in the valley!

8B0B7aIsxIBWwVqeoUdAFQ.text: Best omelet and pancakes ever! I ordered the weekend special, the chicken Tinga omelet.  The omelets come with a choice of bread or pancakes and I chose pancakes.  The pancakes have a hint of lemon and are heavenly.  The home fries do not come out of a bag and I ate all of them, which is something I don't ordinarily do when eating at chain restaurants like IHOP.  However, the star of the meal was the chicken tinga omelet with boneless shredded chicken  breast cooked in adobo and topped with queso fresco - it was totally out of this world delicious!  I left full but not stuffed and will happily be adventuresome with menu selections in the future. The breakfast restaurants in Scottsdale are all overrated and believe me, I have tried them all.  This is my favorite breakfast spot in the Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Tinga Omelet with home fries

97R03-5_SrAwXBfogV59Vg.text: I love their organic selection and excellent service! They had great coffee and tasty specials. Paying cash is not a problem!

cEphDjN-YRUfIaHyKzUzGA.text: Could not be happier that we decided to try OBH. Everything was so good, the service, the food, the menu selection all awesome. Had the biscuits and gravy along with the fried chicken and French toast (their signature item) and without a doubt it's the best French toast we've ever had. Everything is made from scratch, they source locally, use organic produce and you can tell at the first bite. This spot is one of the best breakfast spots in the valley no doubt about it.

IuGLiAKCHUPtVWRGEO_vTw.text: Decievingly modern on the inside compared with the older diner outside appearance.   Had the hot chocolate to start and it was deliciously topped with a light whipped cream and chocolate sauce.   I had the raspberry and chocolate chip pancakes while he had the corned beef hash special. Not sure if I like the lemon flavor added to the pancakes or not but the pancakes themselves were light and fluffy. The raspberries were really fresh and delicious.  He had the corned beef hash special and that came with two eggs cooked any way - he picked scrambled. Oddly enough the corned beef really tasted like salted ham, which isn't bad but not what we expected.   Overall: B+ I think we will order other options next go around but it was tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raspberry chocolate chip pancakes
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Chocolate

UBeYOmo7_Uw7TO2OKD6qjA.text: Great food, clean, and the waiter gave excellent service.. the only issue is they are a cash only place.

ZCuifmsRAMTRL1fY1LjlhA.text: While visiting family in AZ and staying at a resort nearby, we decided to venture out for breakfast in compliments of Yelp reviews. We found this gem...... This has to be the best breakfast place I've been to- hands down!  Service was pretty awesome, the coffee was a great start, the fresh squeezed OJ was right on.  Place was busy the entire time, and all the dishes we had were delicious.  Great QUALITY food, great prices, great service.  Definitely coming here on our next AZ trip.

2cvpuzKF7PGx3cCokkfHcg.text: Love coming here. Some of the best breakfast I have ever had.  There chicken fried chicken is incredible and enough for 3 people.  The deep fried French toast is also amazing.  They only take cash but provide a free to use atm.

0LPoBB8g4jaCvtTrzeOqsg.text: Have been on a quest to find a good down home cook breakfast. This was just ok. Service was great and better than the food. I had chicken fried steak and left 90%  of it on the plate.

bNwIG11bELcatCTDK8toiQ.text: The people and service is great. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The food was AMAZING! I will be recommending this restuarant to everyone I know.

sCGua6HKheFC4CaLdwbkmg.text: What a great restaurant. Good food, very comfortable atmosphere and super friendly staff. I really like that they decided to do all-cash to pay their employees more and I'm happy to support such a business. But if you just go for the food alone, it's worth it!

dW4XoZPyazW9uGRPGk6b_A.text: Items Selected: Lemon Cream Scone Morning Glory Muffin Brioche Cinnamon Roll Strawberry Pop-Tart  Chicken-fried Chicken, Country Gravy, Fried French Toast, Scrambled Eggs Triple Berry Pancakes  Making way to Phoenix for a second consecutive Buckeyes' Fiesta Bowl, this time with two others to share in the fun, Breakfast on Friday was finally enjoyed at Original Breakfast House, the North-Central eatery somehow missed during nearly 18 months of living in the Valley of the Sun.  No doubt growing up a lot in intervening three years, a handful of Artisan Bakeries and Hip Brunch joints cropping up throughout the Metropolitan area, Original Breakfast House is located on N. 32nd Street and, although only born in 2011, the feel is much older - a Californian transplant achieving his goals in ownership by drawing a diverse crowd interested in the restaurant's comfort food classics.  Built on the ideals of good ingredients, smiling service and a 70's roadside decor, it was just past eight in the morning that a party of three was seated at a comfy booth near the entry point, more than half the tables already full with everything from elderly men to school-age children, the Bakery case and a Specials board each within eyeshot and offering no shortage of temptation.  Opting to dine in two-rounds, a total of four baked goods and two plates from the kitchen decided to be more desirable than the rest, items from the counter were presented re-warmed and partially melting, the Brioche Cinnamon Roll not as springy as some and more like Cinnabon while the Morning Glory Muffin was moist, dense and pleasant with a whole lot of Carrots and natural sweetness in the base.  Pleased by the creamy Lemon Scone, though less-so by a Poptart whose shell was unfortunately thicker and even more mealy than the Kellogg original, a stack of Triple Berry Pancakes with $1-supplement Pure Maple Syrup was par for the course with bursting berries both inside and on top of them while the Chicken-fried Chicken with Country Gravy and a slice of fried French Toast was worthy of highlighted-status as the Bird was crisp and juicy while the Bread was golden on the outside with its center Custard-soft.

2PxEzGje-9Uyhni-8hNpCg.text: This is a really great place to take out-of-town guests. Everything is so delicious, from the omelets to the pancakes to the chorizo burritos. High-quality ingredients (like grass fed and finished Arizona beef) at affordable prices. They serve fresh-squeezed orange juice with a free refill. The cinnamon rolls are to die for. Just make sure to take cash out first as they don't accept credit cards (but they do have a nearby ATM).

PuETcNbxbTAUE-ag-LFyUw.text: Their French toast is everything you could want and more! The portions are hearty and you won't leave hungry. This place can be busy but they do a great job at keeping things moving. To top it all off their service is always friendly and attentive. Love me some breakfast and OBH hits the spot!

fUL-RT2fuKqn47PgmR5-DA.text: This place is a local favorite and has some pretty good food. I wish it was a tad more friendly when it comes to alternate life styles (I couldn't have dairy for a long time and had to stop going there because they had nothing for me to eat or drink). The sticky bun here is the best thing I may have ever eaten. It is cash only but they are very upfront about this with tons of signs and an ATM in the entrance.

Otm_5vOtBBP40ymgEmL3Rg.text: My friend and I like to brunch so we chose this place due to Yelp reviews and location. I really love the vibe it's super cute and reasonably priced. My friend is a vegetarian and didn't see anything with that label on the menu but she was told she could have anything she wanted any way she wanted. So that was cool   The location is great and the parking was easy. I had an artichoke bacon goat cheese omelette it was fabulous, fruit and a BIG fluffy biscuit with butter and jam YUMMY it was the "BOMB". So we were two ladies who wanted to chat and have a "catch up" and we were Seated next to the loudest family with two toddlers crying. That was a bummer but it's ok, we could have said something but we didn't. This is a CASH only establishment and that was quite a suprise but it IS posted when you walk in and hey have an ATM . I had cash so that was ok as well, but if I hadn't I tend to be a little persnickety about such things. Now I know and all is good.  So anyhow they have everything breakfast and they have amazing baked goods ugh!!  I will return and try something new, can't wait!

IxK_obtzQRg3veeBDItMZw.text: The food is amazing; I had the Christmas pancakes(spice and apple pancakes topped with bananas, dried cranberries and pecans) and the ham and cheddar omelette. The server was quick and courteous and attentive(Andrea?) and the fresh squeezed OJ was amazing, albeit expensive. I only wish I had room to try the brioche cinnamon rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NH7ltQGI4gagb1s6B08o5A.text: Food was great but lighting was to dim for a breakfast/lunch place it was really noisy and the waitress that had started helping us did not come back to the table till the check was ready other people had to bring our food and drinks.

NqeSE9NnNoqPvL-8F8-tYg.text: My wife and I tried this place because a friend of ours recommended it. This was a great breakfast joint. Now they do serve lunch and dinner by breakfast was my first visit. The staff was friendly and the owners were very nice. They have large portions of food for a really reasonable price. If you are going to eat here make sure you bring cash because credit cards are NOT accepted here. They do have an ATM that has no fees because they cover the cost and they do take checks. They even have an honor system if you forget to bring cash they will take down your name and wait for you to return with the money.  I always thought people from California were rude and arrogant people, but this family that runs this place are a different type of  Californian. I promise you will not be disappointed.

LCw-VUTYEUR_JRs7aC25dw.text: My new favorite place to eat in the Phoenix area! Hands down best food, quality and service.

0VDmmqrMG_dLgPxhvnUb6w.text: Friend staff, great service and the meals were hot and delicious.  Would highly recommend OBH.

VdS0YLeFV3ow9ojB6Cb6EQ.text: Great family owned neighborhood breakfast place - fresh food, mostly from local sources, extensive gluten-free options.  It's been jumpin' every time we've gone.  I've tried a few of the breakfast options: San Francisco style french toast; banana-pecan pancakes; biscuits and gravy; Spam and eggs; the Big Gooey Scramble Mess (share that one); - all good.    Last time, the daily special was an "Indiana Style Pork Tenderloin Sandwich" - had to order that, since those are few and far between outside of the Hoosier home-state.  It was pretty darned good (I like it plain, with mustard and lots of pickles - give it a try!).  The coffee is good, and the servers keep you topped off (or leave a carafe for you).  Service is great, and everyone we've encountered on the staff has been great.  This is a great local place to hang out, grab a bite, and support the community (the restaurant, and their suppliers).  Come check them out!

adTaeTq9LYqLgOHW6rLojw.text: Based on all the reviews on Yelp I had my hopes high. Overall it wasn't a bad place. I I liked the interior, the overall ambience and the service was excellent. The wait staff was very attentive and quick to respond to anything that we had requested. Just for the courtesy of the staff and the promptness I'll give it 5 stars.  The food was unfortunately not to my expectations. Perhaps I was over expecting based on all the previous reviews which I looked over as I was waiting to be seated. I had an omelet and the French toast and while the omelette wasn't bad it was nothing spectacular. I found the French toast to be exceedingly oily and that alone left with me not wanting to come back. The coffee we had was not bad, the orange juice was freshly squeezed and definitely delectable. Like everyone else is already mentioned the portions are generously sized and the prices are reasonable.   For the food alone I would give it 3 stars but the overall experience and the exceptional service pushes it up to 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dvmPzNYiNX3lgig5odoMIw.text: Wow the food was amazing! And the service was kind and swift. Next time I'm trying the pancakes!  Parking: a lot so it's pretty easy. Lot right out front.   Service: we had a party of 5 and they were swift and attentive. They came by with the waters and coffee. We told them we had some place to be after and they listened and helped us out. The venue is clean and cute. I loved watching the home made orange juice being made.   Food: I got the eggs bacon hash browns and pancakes. I loved the crispy hash browns and cool that they give you three slices of thick bacon! What I really liked was the pancakes. They were so yummy and sweet. That home made jam was the best. I would ask for it if I went again and put that on the pancakes and toast! My sister got the gooey eggs with potatoes sausage mush egg and it was huge and super yummy.   Fresh and delish and yummy! I would come back. And I will try some other pancake variety.

3wVfMRpc7MFMQghJh96PHA.text: Great food, prices show it. Always busy, great staff. Owners a hoot. You never leave hungry.  They are only open till 2 2:30.

m9TKqwZOPG2nsm0LeW1Fsw.text: Awful & expensive.  Coffee cold, eggs not cooked well. Sausages not cooked all the way.  Plus, they only take cash.

aCCQ9BCjzcBidwD6t6lAJA.text: This place has got some great menu items. Being a fan of breakfast, it never disappoints. Just understand that it's not inexpensive. And it's cash only. They have conquered the cash only experience by installing no fee ATMs in the restaurant! But if you go on a weekend be prepared for delay as there are always people waiting. But I have never waited longer than 10 to 15 minutes!!

-WXH-Ab8wex4UZ8UrReFsA.text: We enjoyed the food, it was very good, by no means "the best", but no real complaints. It's a dollar or two higher than it should be, but because this place is busy, I understand the higher price, especially since they say they pay their staff well.  What I do not understand, or agree with, is the new cash only policy. Absolutely absurd!  After several years in business, they now say it's because it's too time consuming for them to accept credit cards, and that the cost is too high. I've owned several businesses, and I've never paid more than 2.9% to accept a credit card. If it's a real financial problem, raise your prices 2- 3% which is pennies and a non-issue, and don't play games with the customers who made this place popular in tje first place.  You say there's a free ATM out front, except it's not free. Since it's a private ATM, all major banks charge a several dollar fee to use that ATM.   Funny how virtually 100% of sit down restaurants take credit cards, yet you guys think it's too complicated, and doesn't work for you. You pass the buck, literally, and the nconvenience onto your previously loyal customers.   Your new, silly, cash-only policy t's basically a money grab, where you're banking on your past strong reputation, and taking advantage of people, so you can pocket more cash.  That's shady. It's not right, and I suspect that in the longrun customers will not tolerate it and your greed will not pay off.

T0hwXBI0kTOCM_NPAjNNnw.text: Food was great! Presentation could use a little help. I was disappointed when my plate was set down in front of me. It just didn't look like much...kind of boring and average, but then I took a bite and was pleasantly surprised.

GzM-eiJtgvL_n0ejpp1lBA.text: What a quaint little place. The food was yum yum and the prices were fair. The size is very small and wait averages 20 minuets by a small section of the door way. Server was nice, only down part was his shift ended at 1pm and no one came by to check up on us. They only take cash, fee free atm available inside. Recommend this place for breakfast.

dVMPqgGQwr51nPovxVvZ1A.text: Ah.Maze.Ing!  The menu is diverse and offers a lot and the portions are more than generous!  Food is local, organic, etc.  Staff is very friendly and accommodating. I ordered the B&G and like to think that I'm a pretty good judge (born/raised in the Midwest with lots of Mom n Pop diners/cafes who know how to prepare solid homecooked meals) and I think OBH hits is dead on with their recipe!  Loaded with sausage, biscuits are solid but not heavy and flavor is devine.  Hubby ordered the seafood omelett that Chef offers 1/month - he was in heaven to say the least and the serving was plentiful to fill him up (he's a big guy!). We had the opportunity to talk with our server as well as the owner, great business.  We will return soon, and often!

J2LXMESN8vTBCDFPD5i12Q.text: Fantastic local breakfast joint. Unpretentious and warm service. The 5 egg white scramble is good, but it is out of this world once you add the chorizos on it. Portions are monstrous so don't over do it. The El Paso omelette is also really good. Both came with sides of pancakes that have an awesome lemon zest taste. Definitely will come back.

MMm1cLPBmnt1fWuUE-NIwg.text: Great food and great service!  Relaxed/comfortable atmosphere with very knowledgeable wait staff.  AMAZING chicken fried chicken and fried french toast.  My new go-to breakfast spot.

qktNoe_WCFUTEg0IQC_DOA.text: Quite a few restaurants have opened and closed in this building, but I really hope this one stays!  Our server was very friendly and attentive, and the prices were reasonable.  I ordered the corned beef hash, which was homemade and honestly the best I've had!  The jam was homemade as well, and delicious.   Our server even added some requests to our kids choices, which weren't on the menu.  I will definitely go back!

RzuZnUmL3IQzpICb55hzhA.text: Good food. also had the sexiest server. not sure if she is asian or mexican. but love the fake eyelashes and tight shirt

XsiVQK2PJjSt2szJz-UMIQ.text: Friendly service, tasty baked goods, real fresh-squeezed OJ. My go to spot for breakfast.

5IM0SNY2I24fiLbupTJYQQ.text: The French toast is deep fried and epic!  Eggs were slightly runny but completely offset by the fantastic hash browns and sausage links.  Others in my party had pancakes that were delicious and the OJ seemed to actually be fresh squeezed.   Basically if you're looking for a traditional breakfast place, and not a healthy low fat place, this is what you're looking for.  I will definitely going back soon!

cczsi4zesVoW1x1-R2QNSw.text: First Yelp review...  Consider myself a foodie.  Was staying at the Hilton and stopped bye for a good breakfast as I am not a fan of hotel food.  Loved the food!   Chicken fried chicken was amazing.  My 12 year old daughter made me order seconds and my family ate mine.  All kids (4) loved the French toast.  I would highly recommend if you are in the neighborhood.

da0rbvldDM6qknRFc4zVHA.text: Went here this morning for breakfast with a friend. I had the El Paso omelette and it is definitely one of the best omelettes I have tried in the last few years! My friend had the biscuits and gravy and she said they were really good. Service was excellent and so was the coffee. I will definitely be back here again when I am in the area.

ReS6aC8Y3ZaGzWjZfkninA.text: If you are traveling this is a great bet because the locals eat here.  Nice diner atmosphere with lost of light, good food and great service.  Pancakes are amazing.

RPC09ZLAwqLKaiSzjYFyfQ.text: Second visit, love this place. Food is very good, great atmosphere and excellent service.

ScBJ_ybdpH0zWADQimzXnw.text: I came here wanting to support a local business and something that was not Dennys. I got the biscuits and sausage gravy. Came out cold but it was very tasty. Also got the Denver omelette with the hashbrowns and whole-wheat toast. The toast was amazing fresh and thick, Denver was pretty good and Hashbrowns were really good but could've been cooked more they weren't very crispy on top. Coffee was so good I almost drank the whole mini picher they gave me. All around the atmosphere is awesome and the people are so nice, I will DEF come back here for sure. Please support local and not chains. Oh and they play Elvis Pressley songs.

SsSheiSFhpjC9FC-QwqfAA.text: Enjoyed a great breakfast here this morning. The service was quick and the food was very tasty. Our server, Brittany, was very attentive and super pleasant. We got seated immediately however, it did get very busy and got very loud but that didn't take anything away from the good food and great service. Thanks Brittany!

0vMpO9NgUpPMMdix-iHeLg.text: Looking for a great breakfast and relied on YELP. A little out of our way, going home to Vegas but it was a learning experience. The place was still crowded at 10 am on a Sunday, good sign, got seated within a half hour.  The staff was friendly and attentive, so a 4 star there; the food was something else. After all the hype we read from the pictures and the previous reviews, we expected better. I had the crab omelet special; it was bland, the hollandaise sauce had no taste and it was just crab meat with minimal amount of cheese added to it. The home fries were burnt or over cooked (I looked and seen other plates and this was the norm); very disappointing. My spouse had the French Toast with strawberries. It looked good upon presentation, but the crust was unedible, like it was deep fried or something. We also ordered a side  rib eye steak and that was over cooked. All and all, IHOP would have been a better place to have breakfast. So over all, a 3 star and that's being nice.

mUf4Mw_81VYgEOUitWWTDw.text: Great breakfast place. Out 11 year old said the pancakes were the best he'd ever had. Husband loved his hash. My pork chops and eggs were delicious. Fresh squeezed oj with free refill a real treat.  Even saw the guy squeezing the oranges so that tells you how fresh it was.

xI68eUA0m9FanFNa1Zs5RA.text: Will def be back , great breakfast food .. Unique deep fried French toast . The fresh squeezed Oj is so good , and you get 1 refill with the Oj (most places you don't) . Even the jelly for your toast is homemade . So many good sounding choices on the menu . A must try if your in the area !

-7v2qOVlXkyweHuwsv2YyA.text: My new favorite breakfast place! It doesn't look like much driving by, but it's worth the spot. They have fresh squeezed OJ that's amazing. They also use locally grown and some organic items. The pancakes are delicious, with a pleasant, light taste of lemon in the batter. My omelet was $10.95 BUT came with 2 sides (I chose home fries and pancakes), so there is plenty of yummy food for the price. It's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caprese omelette (yum!)

lz6t8cZ42njeknwXNx6MpQ.text: Ate here today for the first time, and was pretty surprised at the food! It was all very good especially the fresh squeezed orange juice!!! Prices were great and the amount of food was a lot!! I would def eat there again and recommend it anyone looking for a good breakfast place!

lk9yLp7GabeKY0U_5dx30A.text: Service was great.  But I am into a little more upscale food, less fattening, just a preference. If you enjoy just having the ol staple hearty breakfast, it's a good place to go.

I04b4iMC0_ij0piwOfFJtg.text: Although this place is always busy, it is worth the wait. I love you pecan banana pancakes.

_KiiBI7yG3j__F-G7WHd5A.text: We are visiting from out of town and tried this place based off reviews. It was worth the wait! Great food and service!

fKkxTKazVz_ElCfAgHer4w.text: Tried it once and wouldn't be back to this spot. Over priced breakfast and definitely could get a better breakfast at Denny's for half the price! Burgers were 3 out of 10, salad was weak. Not a place we'd go back to.

SWIjC7fhVrKuBEDTn30Ayg.text: Worth the drive!!!! Best breakfast spot in Phx! Staff extremely friendly & efficient. Pricey but worth it. French toast is a must!

yM_1jLM9QRde9Zc0RWzYUQ.text: Use to be one of our favorite breakfast spots. No more it's cash only. You wait to get a table with is fine but wait to get cash out of a machine isn't. Just add 3% to your menu and call it a day. Won't be back until they join the real world.

V0nqBnwtk1EH98qcazFqsg.text: So good!!! Oh my gosh the portions were huge and food was fantastic! I had the carnitas omelette, hubby had French toast, kids had pancakes and cinnamon rolls (huge and amazing!) Worth the wait. Everything was delicious! Services was also fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas omelette

BFdb9d-Oc-P3ED_aloupqg.text: Whenever I want to try a new spot, I go to Yelp and sort the reviews, reading the worst ones first.  All of the bad reviews of this place had to do with them only accepting CASH as payment.  There were no complaints about the food so I figured I would try it.  We arrived, cash in hand at about 9:30 on a Sunday morning.  As I approached the door I noticed the "SORRY, CASH ONLY" sign.  We waited about 30-40 minutes to be seated (always a sign of a good place) and were immediately acknowledged by a smiling server who took our drink order.  On the way to our table, I couldn't help but notice several more signs explaining the CASH ONLY policy.  We had pancakes, french toast, chicken-fried steak and biscuits and gravy.  All of it was good and reasonably priced.  Our check came and I handed the server a credit card.  She took it like a champ and was as pleasant as can be.  I highly recommend you try this place.  And oh...they only accept CASH!

P73rxIsa-lGET5061T_2qw.text: I had the French toast which was solid but a tad bit dry.  Coffee was average but I work for Starbucks so I'm a bit opinionated.  Bacon was delicious.  Brought home a cinnamon roll which was very good.

AlxrbC_XZg266rkydEJ2HA.text: Long wait but well worth it.  We enjoyed the food and the service.  We will definitely be back.  Maybe will try to go earlier next time to avoid long wait.

IU_ykInFoKgSEX9C8I4MZA.text: Excellent.  Creative food combinations that you just rarely see at other restaurants. Service is excellent and very friendly. There is an amazing canopied area where you can sit in case you're waiting in line.

L1gJSP-MfOkvjZxffJIcGQ.text: Love this place.  Went there Saturday morning with one of my college age nieces while her car was getting worked on.  One word, AMAZING. I'm not an adventurous eater at all so I stuck with the basics.  Scrambled eggs with melted cheese on top, bacon, hashbrowns and whole wheat toast and of course black coffee.  I have to say, the bacon was about as perfect as bacon can be.  I mean, bacon, it makes everything better right?  But this stuff was amazing.  Crisp, but not burnt, not at all soggy or undercooked, not all shriveled up like some of the cheaper cuts of bacon.  This stuff was PERFECT and oh so tasty.  Needless to say, the bacon was gone before I even considered the rest of the plate.  The eggs were excellent as were the hashbrowns and the nice thick toast.  Now onto the service. We pulled into the parking lot, the place was packed.  We checked in and they said about 15 minutes.  Well, they were spot on.  Inside of 15 minutes we had a table.  Our waitress, I'm sorry but I can't recall her name, was very friendly and helpful.  She wasn't overbearing by coming back to check on us too often but she was right there when my coffee needed a top off.  We had a nice quick chat about how bacon is the perfect food and how the we like our coffee the same, strong with no junk added.  Food was out quick and like I mentioned, damn good.  My only regret, was not getting the pancakes after seeing the ones my niece had ordered.  Dang, those looked good!  Next time, the pancakes will be mine.  The only "negative" point in my view is they recently switched to cash only.  They do post a nice explanation on why they are cash only and as someone who has previously worked in retail business, it makes sense.  They do provide a free ATM inside the restaurant so that does help.  I can't ding them on the cash only part, it's their way of paying the employees more and they sure all seemed to be in good spirits when we were there.  All hustling about and everyone I saw was smiling.  Well worth what some people might consider the hassle of paying in cash.

_9WjavpUuQbBZ8dpKy82tw.text: Surprised by this great little find! Stopped in for a quick bite and found myself dreaming of California beaches and missing home. Had the steak and eggs, absolutely delicious! The deep fried French toast is sinful  Do yourself a favor and stop in for a bite and enjoy. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this little place !

DcOXTnLjOjHx2dEqBL3Vew.text: I'm BIG on customer service and waitress Emily has exceeded my customer service experience. Emily was knowledgeable about the menu, Provided our order in a timely manner and perform all other tasks with a nice smile. Overall, the team at OBH attains excellent hospitality! Please keep up the great work. My boyfriend and I will definitely be returning for more breakfast sessions. The food is delicious. Point. Blank. Period. We'd love to continue supporting this business.   P.S. Thank you for introducing me to the amazing pepper plant sauce. I was missing out for so long until I visited the original breakfast house.   Shoutout to the free OJ refill, free ATM serivce (Cash-only restaurant) and big portion platters. You're speaking my language!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THIS SHIT RIGHT HERE IS THE BOMB!!!!!!!!! TRY IT!

xVcEgNj4lKs2TwmTTJJnpg.text: The tiramisu pancakes were AUHMAZING!! Great service, delicious food, and overall "homey" feeling as you walk in. just be sure to pack your patience because there will be a wait (for good reason).

RChJdWB0_IpkZ_pXBF3xmQ.text: Great food and fantastic service, I was traveling on business and I was a little taken back that they only accepted cash, but I did have enough green backs to cover my wonderful breakfast, they also have a ATM conveniently located in the lobby.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Be prepared cash only, they do have an ATM inside if you need cash.   Great food and fantastic service.

m5nTkaxJvy23VWxymhPnxw.text: I love the fact  that this is a family-owned restaurant and the food is always fabulous. They come up with some great seasonal items from time to time and they are all delicious. just recently enjoyed their Mexican Eggs Benedict. Their homemade scones and other pastries are also delightful. Well worth the calories.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Eggs Benedict

dBK-a4eOJPpKEaQ8sqq89g.text: Best French toast I've ever had. It's a cash only business.. but there is an atm. So come prepared for that! Great quick service. And we went on Easter morning and still only had to wait less than 30 minutes!

EGOU-sBy5Rk6-w5j2NCG-w.text: This place has been in business for 4 years and already has 900 reviews. There is a reason for it. We came on Saturday of Memorial Day weekend with a party of 8. Wait time we were told would be 20-25 minutes. With the huge line of people outside we questioned that. I set the stopwatch. 22 minutes later we were sat!  Now onto the food. Eight people, eight reviews in one word each. 1: French toast with eggs and bacon- delicious. 2: cinnamon roll pancakes- so-good. 3: blueberry pancakes - fantastic. 4: pancakes and bacon - a little to good. 5: cinnamon roll pancakes with a side of bacon- rich. 6: cheesy eggs - eggcellent. 7: chicken fried chicken with eggs and French toast- underpricedheaven. 8: linguica and cheddar scramble - fantastic.  Bottom line is John who greeted us at the table has really got something here. I worry that his prices are just too low though. Nice to have met you John and remember always trust a fat guys review! Lol.  This is my family's new favorite breakfast spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry pancakes
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken, French toast and cheesy eggs
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguica and cheddar scramble

IHtQwSj09OpmHvGZw321hg.text: Phenomenal breakfast and awesome customer service ! Server was extremely friendly and even told us a little history about the place ! Will be coming back again

exXmRD2PqqsJgvB_8_29NQ.text: Landed in Phoenix and yelped best place to eat breakfast and this place pops up. We decided to check it out and it did not disappoint!! Their famous chicken fried chicken was amazing! So was the chiquul... chilequil...um. breakfast nachos! Dont leave without getting the raspberry creme pancakes!!! They've perfected the blend of creamy and tart, not too sweet, 5 star pancakes!! Super friendly folks, a great way to start your morning in Phoenix. Would eat here again!

MZpQ__hAhQll7-vRinBLyg.text: Food was great and our waitress was awesome.  She is someone that truly seems to love her job.  She was both informative and enthusiastic about the menu.  This was good "from scratch" cooking and everything was tasty.  This is a cash only restaurant but they do have an ATM on site with no fees.

hAoffmujVroD27zpiMpo1Q.text: Had the chicken-fried steak today and it was horrible the gravy tasted like paste. No flavor at all. Breakfast is very expensive even though it indicates on Yelp that it a cheap place to go. $4 for an orange juice is a little high if you ask me.

VSDPWY5UzO5t5lHEwCFlZQ.text: Perfect, just perfect breakfast spot. Visiting the area from PA and used Yelp reviews to find this gem. The French toast was as amazing as other reviews indicated. I guess you really can't go wrong with great sourdough, custard-like egg dip and the deep frying. Delish!  My husband said the pancakes were "the best he ever had!" you can taste the orange zest and it was light and yet filling.  We also had the Juan's tacos -- they were satisfying and quintessentially southwest breakfast.  BUT the best part was the Patty's brioche cinnamon buns. Holy Amazing.

WJxdfaUwpHPhKBQGacp-Fw.text: Excellent service and great food!  If you get a chance, Fridays during Lent they do a fish fry to benefit the Boys and Girls Club.

CEYXOrN1IbpmKla1OH-Elw.text: Breakfast at this place is straight up amazing. I've taken multiple friends and coworkers, as well as my parents when they visited, and everybody has loved it. My go-to is the five egg whites scramble or the French toast.

IwvkwzovyK6E7f-OPMZcSA.text: Found on Yelp, enjoyed the banana pecan French toast!  People are friendly and service was fast.

jl3IAS_NoXQpJg-ILGGxzw.text: My son and I had never been here before, so we thought we'd try it out.  It's located in the same plaza as Alice Cooper's "Church of Rock."  The service was spectacular and the food was absolutely delicious.  We will certainly go back and will highly recommend it to friends and family.

xkllxdO7-1SjhwNd6k3OAA.text: Wonderful breakfast. Owner was there, making the rounds, early on a Sunday morning. He was seating people and clearing tables as needed. Hostess (who may have also been family) was full of personality, too. Nice people. Restaurant was clean, modern, nice decor. Good coffee, flavored creamers, they left the coffee pitcher in the table, which is great. Water pitcher on the table, too. Great service. Waitresses actually seemed to enjoy working there, and I assume that a good portion of the reason for that was the leadership and management. Food was excellent too. I had the juevos rancheros and my husband had the chorizo burrito. When I couldn't decide on my side item, and chose beans, the waitress pointed out that there were beans in the juevos, so I switched to potatoes. That really showed she cared and was thinking. I appreciated that. The potatoes were excellent. Husband loved the burrito. I found this place online last night, listed as one of the best breakfast places in Phoenix, and I can see why. I don't think it even took 5 mins to get our food. We drove almost 45 mins from Gilbert to come here, and we'll be back!

v0pF6S4-iX6FBfNyi1KpUg.text: First time here today for breakfast and we had an awesome experience.  The hostess and our server, Casey (I think?) were super friendly and warm.  The food portions were huge and quality was great!  We will definitely be back again soon, as the huge menu had so many delicious options... we have to try them all!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana Pecan French Toast
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros with a side of Linguica sausage

9uHYfirmv5kbbjM1ntxnbA.text: Lots of yummy stuff here, from the pancakes to the deep fried french toast to the omelettes.  Delish!  Kind of a diner atmosphere, good service.

INdIrKlbwaujp2jpmAJLTg.text: Consistent great fresh food. Pancakes are amazing. The only reason for 4 and not 5 stars is the atmosphere.  They've added too many tables in too small an area which makes for an incredibly loud atmosphere because they're always busy.

6hI6wsMWq2z2HbnkYWdmmQ.text: Happened to be in the neighborhood this morning so stopped by for breakfast.  Ten-minute wait for two at 9 am on a Saturday isn't bad.  Had the Farmer's Market omelet with a fruit side and an upgrade to a scone.  Scone was very good -- not too big and very fresh.  Omelet was average and a little bland.  The food and service are on par with The Good Egg, i.e., fairly ordinary.  Not worth a special drive from Central PHX -- stick to Matt's, Scramble, Snooze, or Daily Diner.

7eT6k29bsNtK6WnvSHGJjQ.text: One of  best breakfast places I have had in a long time. Service staff really well trained and it showed. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs and it was amazing. Will definitly be coming back. Thanks to the owner John for having such a great place to eat will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs

ehTNSxT-Po0cqv5XiYM3Jg.text: I kept hearing from friend about how great this place was so one day I decided to come with and it was a great decision!   I had the French toast which was great but I think the sausage and eggs were even better! The coffee was great as well.   The best part is the service. We kept asking for more things and she was always very nice and positive the whole time. Good overall experience, although it was kind of hot inside the restaurant. I'll be back!

1Slu9Y8uDHVrw-BTrPUuhg.text: Today was the first time going to OBH, and it definitely won't be my last! The carnitas omelette with the home-fries was amazing, and the fresh fruit bowl actually had good fruit in it(strawberries, blueberries, and bananas). The staff was super friendly and the food came out fast! Such a great place!

bCg-NsMxBdLIVHO_Z9Uv2A.text: great food and a very welcoming staff. They also had freshly squeezed Orange juice..which was an amazing change. The portions are huge and I absolutely loved the sides.

4bXZzhcO5w8Y_uFKZwlCcA.text: Always enjoy eating here! Good food, good coffee, good service...what more do you need?!! My husband likes their omelettes (always orders something different each time we go)...and says they have the fluffiest pancakes. I like their oatmeal (it's not mushy!) with banana slices, pecans, raisins and almond milk. Lots of restaurants have been on this corner and gone by the wayside. This owner is here to stay!

J8gPpQHoqkDPUGH4oLTMaw.text: The first time we came here a couple of weeks ago, we decided to hold off on our review because there were a few flaws with our experience but we hoped we could give them the benefit of the doubt and try a second time. We are SO glad we did.  The staff are all very pleasant and make for a positive experience as soon as you walk in the door. The portion sizes are plenty of food to fill you up at very reasonable prices. Coffee was wonderful, exactly what a nice breakfast brew should be. The eggs have been perfectly cooked on both plates both times we were there. And the fresh squeezed orange juice just CAN'T be beat. VERY pulpy which for me is a huge plus. Also, their cinnamon rolls are outstanding; large and fluffy with just the right amount of sweetness.  The biscuit gravy, unfortunately left a lot to be desired. It had a sweet quality that I've never had in breakfast gravy and didn't work for me at all. The hashbrowns, while good, not too oily/butter and reasonably salted, are pretty inconsistent. The first time we went, we had one order that was very overdone and another order that was very underdone while the second time we went, the one order we had was just right.  I can't speak to the french toast, though I know it's something they're known for and it's definitely something I plan to try. Not the best breakfast joint in the world but a more than satisfactory experience that is well worth the money.

uUPY_nxjs6wTSLEFiWKUYg.text: I decided to try this place due to the high ratings by other yelp recommendations but was let down and underwhelmed by the food and service. The wait time we were quoted was more than doubled and the food was sub-par. I'd suggest trying your luck at another local restaurant.

2NQSxT9axSRpaTp_lSLOPQ.text: Food was delicious! My boyfriend and I love trying different breakfast spots and we definitely are impressed. My only complaint is the wait. We were told the wait would be 30min and we waited 50 min. Other than that, we would definitely come back again!

OVRI8rpB1U6j1eDjQQ72rA.text: Had a great breakfast. Again. Linguica was excellent. Very pleasant service.  Very quick as  well. Got a wonderful greeting from Brittany the hostess with a smile that could melt steel. Gina was very friendly and gave excellent service. Can't beat this place.

ADXnY2zVEoMXPFqvVYDYeA.text: Wow!!! This was a nice surprise. Not only was our breakfast delicious but we had great customer service. I had the spam, eggs and cilantro lime rice. I wanted to try something new and I'm happy I did. My boyfriend had the French toast "YUM" !! And my daughter had the chocolate chip pancakes. I recommend you stop here to have your breakfast :)

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fIhSfA-1WHg00tOec_Jv_g.text: This place is cash only. There's an ATM inside. Also it's like a California vibe inside because of all the surf boards and it's like a diner inside.   I ordered a cold brew but I didn't like it you need to add your own flavor and sugar. I also ordered a omelette, hog heaven and I replaced the ham with spinach and added onion, bell peppers & avocado. It comes with hash browns and toast or pancakes, I chose wheat bread. The omelette is good but the toast was thick and burn/hard. The hash browns are crispy on top but in the middle it's very soft, I wish they were crispy everywhere. The food definitely tasted homemade.   My brother got the linguica and cheese which is scramble eggs with Portuguese sausage and cheese. It comes with hash browns and your choice of bread or pancakes.   There's a water jug on all the tables. They squeeze fresh orange juice.

z1QDhvkkTMsBCFetmcOf3Q.text: After driving all through the night, downing whiskey and firing off rounds, we came across the best breakfast place. You already know what place I'm talkin about cuz you're reading the Yelp review for it. Don't dilly dally. Don't drag your friend. Go to Original breakfast house and ask for Alix, say the Blood Moon Howlers sent ya

-k-qaNgzyy6hlRfEUCY2UQ.text: Decided to make this our last stop before heading back to California. We were already on our way and drove back 15 min just to check it out. First things first. WOOOOOOOOW!!!! This place is awesome!! It's cash only but for good reason! They explain it on the menu for you. Had the fried chicken and French toast. Holy hell! It was amazing. Service was on point! People on here complaining about the wait...it's amazing so obviously there will be a wait! I would give this place more stars if I could. Our experience here was amazing! Our waitress Dallas was awesome! Extremely polite and courteous! We will officially make this our last stop for breakfast EVERY TIME we come to AZ! Only bad this here is the fact that I couldn't control myself and over ate.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RGx3KbjRpnn67W5tkpiQxg.text: It's a good place, friendly service.  Seating was fairly quick, pretty busy a 9am.  A little disappointed in the lincuisa and cheddar scramble.  The OBH Benedict had amazing hollandaise sauce.  Would come again and try something new.

beHWPamYJpv8sdtuLtrXug.text: I had the Chicken fried chicken and French toast. The chicken fried chicken was good but not everything it was hyped up to be on here. The French toast though.. very tasty. The place is small and very tight quarters but the customer service is very good. Waiter was very friendly and genuine, not that fake kind of friendly. I would definitely return and am excited I found this place close to my home. I found my new breakfast spot and will be trying their variety of other menu items. Be prepared though, I was surprised they only accept cash for payment, but I always carry cash.

IG1Rz5O1QbxTmu0wWWxTgg.text: Original Breakfast House   Wow! This place is so good. It's a local spot in North Phoenix that has a very laid back vibe. More than a dozen various surf boards, skateboards and an autographed Alice Cooper Guiter adorn the walls's and posts with a very beach centric theme. There is a written message / mural near the front door notifying customers of the OBH efforts to use local and organic food.   One thing to be aware of. This place is cash only. If you only have a card, no worries. There is a no-fee ATM in the lobby.   Here's our thoughts on what we had:  Cinnamon Roll: These are strategically placed near the front door in a bakery style case and it definitely worked on us. We started with the Cinnamon Roll which was perfectly warm and gooey. The bread is perfect and the icing was delicious. Grade: A+  El Paso Omelette: We got this without the black beans and it was O-MAZING. The flavor of the chorizo, the cheese melted inside the omelette, green chili's, salsa, guac and sour cream were a home run. This is one of those places where by this one dish, you know all of the other food is going to be dynamite. My wife and I split this dish and it was a perfect size for us. Grade: A+  Hash Browns: Very well done. A lot of crunch on top with side potatoes on the inside. Perfect. Grade: A  Biscuits: These were a little above average. They are definitely fluffy and have a tang of buttermilk. We made them better by adding butter and some of the local organic honey they provided. The biscuit is a perfect base for their home made jelly as well. Grade: B-  Bacon: Perfectly cooked. Not over done but not soggy at all. A good level of crunch and packed with flavor. Grade: A  Pancakes: These hit me with a surprise. The good part is they are very good as well as gluten free. The part I wasn't expecting was the lemon zest. It wasn't bad, just unexpected. I don't care for fruit or fruit flavors to be mixed into my breakfast foods but I'm sure many people will like them. The butter and syrup were on point as well. Grade B+  Service: As much as we loved the food we were especially thrilled with our server, Seta. Always on time, friendly, appropriately talkative and kind. Everyone seemed to love their jobs and that is a reflection on the ownership. The waitress also told us the owner allows the chef free reign to try new things and that great pairing shows in the food. Grade: A++   Summary: We will definitely be back and with friends and family. Wherever you are in the valley, make the trip to OBH and you won't leave disappointed.

b7wX_P0YOLymrNdsUEt-7Q.text: Came in around 7:40am on a Saturday and didn't have to wait for a table of two, but there were still already a good amount of people inside. Like all of the other reviews and tips, yes this place is cash only but they do have an ATM. Reading why they made the decision sits well with me so be sure to grab some cash and come check this place out!  The inside is cute, it's very diner meets a beachy/surf board theme. We were greeted as soon as we walked in by friendly faces and taken to a table. Our waitress stopped by shortly after and was super nice, grabbing our drink orders. We stuck with iced tea and water to start.   The menu is a good size and had a lot of appetizing items. I was torn on several of them but finally settled on the pancake special: I chose raspberry chocolate pancakes, bacon and scrambled eggs.   The pancakes were awesome.. the raspberry added a great tart flavor to balance the chocolate. They don't skimp on filling either, lots of chocolate chips and raspberry in the batter as well as on top. They also brought a side of syrup and butter depending on your pancake preferences. The bacon is thicker cut but isn't too crispy and isn't too soft. Great flavor. The eggs were good as well.   My girlfriend got the chicken and waffles which comes with a side of sausage gravy, as well as butter and syrup too. You get two large fried pieces of chicken breast and a full waffle. The chicken is awesome and pairs nicely with the waffle. The waffle isn't soggy and has a nice outer "crunch" to it. The sausage gravy was delicious and would go well over some biscuits. Portion sizes were huge for both meals.   She also ordered a glass of milk to come out with our food. She orders this with breakfast a lot and most places forget it.. which is understandable since drinks normally come out first but our waitress remembered and brought it out with our food! She was on top of everything, brought refills and was honestly just genuinely so nice.   I saw some people walking up to the register to pay but our waitress actually took our check from us and brought us back change. I'm not sure which way is the "usual" way but hey, we paid!  Overall I'd definitely recommend coming here for breakfast and will absolutely return. Awesome!

feJAdN93RqsXHaUMcqtuAQ.text: Awesome breakfast food and fast service. The place seems pretty busy both times I was there. Nonetheless we were seated promptly and food came quickly. Tastes familiar to the diners of the east coast with a west coast vibe. Be aware that they only take cash payments but there is an ATM on site and the transaction was fee was waived.

-DYyZ-wyUDKe0FgUZQx4RQ.text: Great little breakfast spot, the wait can be about 40 min or more but luckily we only had a 20 wait. This is a cash only place but they provide a atm with no fees so that's nice.  All the food that came out looked really good, I would have to say I really enjoyed the sausage gravy. It's simple but really tasty. The green pork chili omelette was good, not spicy at all. Food portions are good size.  They offer free cold water bottles while u wait and have a canopy to provide shade with lots of seats.

9jJpmHFVzMgD35i5bYyToQ.text: ***Be advised that this restaurant ONLY takes cash; they do have ATM's in the restaurant. I posted some photos I took of their policy as to why they only take cash.***  One of my buddies from work constantly raved about this place. We finally had the time to check it out on 26 JUL 2018 AD. The vibe of the place is a little, "California", there are some surf boards posted on the walls and the dining area is laid-back.  The food, service and menu offerings were off-the-charts!!! Everything was terrific! The price was decent and the portion size sufficient. The establishment was clean and organized.  I shall return if in the area again, and whole-heartily recommend this restaurant to family and friends! A solid 5 stars!!!
