Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #mine
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. U can doodle while u wait.

D-czASLLnm_KL__OWn80QQ.text: Five stars, every time! My family eats here every weekend. My husband loves the chilaquiles and green chile pork omelette. I love the egg white scramble. My daughter is a bacon aficionado and has given her approval.   All the staff members are friendly, genuine and attentive. We honestly feel like family when we come in every week. Please keep up the great work and fantastic service!

wvvxsPzsTpeZOHuLuLe6hA.text: Great place for breakfast, very cozy and retro.   This is great hidden gem that we were surprised how good the food is.

XV0n_qpuqlUgtq3oA8rYhw.text: This place is top notch. their specials are always delicious. I usually have the Linguica scramble(spicy Portuguese sausage) with the banana pancake and breakfast potatoes and it's always delicious.  their fresh squeezed OJ is to die for.  it's always reeeeeeeeally busy on the weekends so be prepared to wait a bit. It's 100% worth it though. They have fresh baked breakfast pastries (scones, muffins, cinnamon rolls, homemade pop tarts ) which i always want to try but am too full!!! they looks scrumptious though!  this is a place i always take people who visit me from out of town. Great spot!!

UblbT1sK_XBZSf2vuRbipg.text: Delicious place for breakfast. I had the French toast special with sausage and hash browns. The fresh squeezed orange juice is worth the price as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast special with sausage and hash browns.

M7YhTWKxqmc2GS_ttIGyBw.text: Service was a little slow but that was to be expected with not one empty seat in the house and this was on a Tuesday at brunch hour. The servers were all really friendly and the owner came out to personally thank my table for dining. The food was good. It had a good home cooked taste to it not like something from ihop.

smYTXM8TDadTZWGDPqOsuQ.text: Best breakfast in town!!! The chicken fried chicken and French toast combo is one of the best things on the menu. You get one free refill on the fresh squeezed orange juice. The most amazing chipped beef Ive had. Daily fresh-baked cinnamon rolls. Excellent customer service. I just can't get enough of this place

R8nB9Cn5AoQAr9wfOa1N5A.text: Was hoping for so much more after reading the reviews. Staff - great, they were all polite and smiles The wait- 15 min as they said it would be The food- lacking, both my wife and I were disappointed in the Popeyes omelette and the south west one. The onions inside were almost raw in both. Sometimes bigger is not always better. Biscuit and gravy read on the menu to sound fantastic but again just fell flat.  Wish AZ had Norm's Restaurant then this place could try better food and imitate it.  Decor- outdated and very random.

1XP5K98a24FQb6_0l6eUPA.text: This place was overrated. Wasn't greeted with the customer service everyone said they had.... we waited a while before our waiter even came by. The eggs weren't very good and were mushy. I will agree that the cinnamon pancakes were delicious. I'd come back for pancakes, but overall I've definitely have had better.

HtEngAO_H49l-Dka1cuuKg.text: We came to Original Pancake House after Easter service. Staff is outstanding, friendly. Their food, served with great smile is Great!# Consistently wonderful "GREAT FOOD". Great staff.  10 stars.

DsdfyOYFyS7lt3gAwCMsNA.text: OBH is a family favorite- we go often and have always had stellar service and the food is excellent and always prepared perfectly. Their coffee and iced tea and always fresh. The staff is kind and accommodates any requests we have.

U1DRbbzVzL7s_Twsipvk8w.text: I took my son here on a breakfast date. We both enjoyed our food! It came out fast and portions are huge!  Love the fresh squeezed orange juice. Amazing service! Food was DELISH. Love the homey feel this place has! I'd rather come here than any other breakfast place.  Support small business when at all possible!

qnx61jSNfsSxKr4s8kiEzg.text: First time here, this place was AMAZING!!!!! We came on a Friday Morning at 8:00 am so no wait, but I can see it being super busy on the weekends. My fiance got the biscuits and gravy and I got the carnitas omelette with the raspberry chocolate chip pancakes. All were awesome! Be warned that the portions are generous and to-go boxes were needed. They work with local growers and sausage makers. They bake their one pastries and biscuits. I can't rave enough about and can't wait to bring the rest of my family back!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas omelette with raspberry chocolate chip pancakes

9ZMCGx_aArlhRehG0biYyg.text: The service is STELLAR. You can't help but feel your mood improve after leaving. Waiters are so sweet. The owner is sweet. Everyone is smiling.  Food is pretty good- I've had some hits/misses. (But the asparagus chicken goat cheese omelet- SO GOOD!!) The portions are huge, the prices are reasonable. The coffee is great.   I honestly just love coming here and seeing all the different people. Friends meeting up, brunch dates, single diners reading the newspaper. It feels like living in a small town. Not some pretentious hip mimosas-serving spot. Just your friendly diner.   Seriously- this place will forever be my favorite brunch spot.

2SFI-WB_nfFkmJD02zZisw.text: OBH has been my best breakfast experience in the Phoenix area. The staff have been wonderful. The price is right. The food is amazing and reminds me of home. The orange juice is delish. I have never tasted French toast quite like these yummy gems.  The atmosphere is wonderfully casual and unique. The worst thing about this place is the ugly generic chairs. They just do not fit the style and vibe that I get from the rest of the joint. But the chairs are far from anything that could take me away from this tasty experience.  OBH is definitely worth the visit.

6MfaeM2whzPj83bzEspz1A.text: The only thing better than the food was the service. I have been to a lot of breakfast place around the country and I can easily say that this was by far the best experience I have ever had. Orange juice was fresh squeezed and came with one free refill. The coffee was delightful fragrant with just the right amount of kick. The food was what really knocked my socks off, I didn't really know what to expect but the overall quality was amazing. The majority of their ingredient are purchased locally and farm fresh. If you are ever in the phoenix area do yourself a favor and come have the best breakfast around.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken and French toast

AqXkAabVb5pzVqD3Xrvz0w.text: When we first walked in, the place had a weird smell.  The breakfast is great...had the chocolate chip raspberry pancakes and they were just delish!  The kids enjoyed their food as well.  It is close to our house so I am sure we will be back!

9bUG1pWm4meDxH02ZIKXXg.text: No surprise the reviews are so high for this place.   Ordered French toast, it was deep fried and delicious. Eggs, sausage and bacon on the side. The sausage was excellent!  Fresh squeezed orange juice. And the coffee is good too.   Had some of my guest's hash browns and pancakes. Everything was great including the service. Divina helped us this morning and was an absolute pleasure.   They had a reindeer sausage special that was tempting. Same with a 3-berry French toast which looked good on the table next to me.   Will be back soon!

-lvtX9QcAyDkSnrwFGnG_w.text: Customers for life! Wonderful family, wonderful food, we love OBH. Divina is our favorite server :) Always a wait, but its well worth it!

C1sjmxVAr1YGBbZI9vfcrA.text: So good.  The bacon: perfection.   The french toast : to dies for.  The pancakes : oh my  stars, the blackberry  ones were so good and fluffy.   But the standout  for me was the sausage.  It was delicious, so good that I had to finish it, no matter how full I was.   The service was great too.  Very warm, family style feel.

gzwX5fOmVaE2KDG4KncnZA.text: Great service once we got to our table.  We waited around 20 minutes to be seated - not bad for Sunday morning.  They have a great variety of good food.  I'll certainly return even though it's a bit of a drive for me.

xYB0L2xJnaU2CN-6dZwwvw.text: Local home-cooked family breakfast joint. Food is always good and service is great. My go to place for breakfast. The only downside is they don't have English muffins.

PDxkx2wjDakWGdKm9x06nQ.text: This is our family go to place for awesome food!  We are never disappointed!  7 of us met today and we are thrilled with the service, food and ambiance!  Celebrates the adult grandson's birthday. Enjoyed their anniversary party and brought home commemorative mugs!  Thank you!!

Vc0D4psa9RLP7P6T-fzePQ.text: Living in the neighborhood for so long I was surprised I had not seen this earlier. Happened to drive by it one day so I looked it up on Yelp to find good reviews.  We decided to stop in and try it and it lived up to the reputation. Food was good. Coffee was good. Staff were friendly. It's a nice place. We shall return.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That famous french toast everyone mentions on here...
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguica special w/ cheddar scramble and hash browns

smsqfSL0g33UMuhYKMeNUw.text: Wow - can't beat this place for the food and the service. Having moved to the area and being a regular now, I enjoy seeing Dustin and John and Hayley always takes such good care of me and my table. We always bring our out of town friends and they all wish that they had an OBH in their neighborhood. And even though I'm a vegetarian, John (the owner/operator) has great options on the menu, and based upon feedback is changing to vegetarian beans and rice (instead of using chicken stock).   Love the fact that, even though he's a successful long term restaurateur, he's open to suggestion from his customers.   With all of the above, he's got a winning combination.   My very fave breakfast spot!!!

RQFmU_KEUUIZCMyxlFLACw.text: Pancakes were good. Lamb was just okay. Hubs had the El Paso and he said it was good but soggie because they didn't drain the beans.

TvPIOv9T26c6uPJgiEpC7g.text: What a great breakfast place. Not only is the food delicious but the attentive service we received was awesome. Thank you very much!

LxiRHAkpZGMOD1qVbFdiiw.text: Wow, this place has some unique items that you won't find anywhere else.  I really liked that.  I had the chicken fried steak and deep fried French toast and it was tasty.  I've never had FT deep fried and it was worth it.  My mom had an egg breakfast.  We were pleasantly filled up.  We had a 10 or 15 minute wait on a weekend day.   Love the tie-dye shirts that the employees wear.  The have Triple Berry French Toast which I am dying to try.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried chicken w/ deep fried French toast &amp; two eggs. $10.95, real maple syrup $1.00 more ~ Best French toast ever!

TuyBjiBc_oBMh4V3S-ox1w.text: We eat here often and it's always great. They have fresh OJ and many choices for every one to choose from.  It's clean and bright and the staff is always happy.

yQJ_krpRqPMve7MBRrk-KA.text: Great place with fresh food always, love the freshly squeezed orange juice. Very pleased with the service and how quickly the food comes. Thank you for always being so great.

1dPImP4nQVmgc7dDwC72eA.text: OMG We LOOOOOOOVE this place and its organic goodness But it's a wait on the weekends but sooooo worth it! Bring a dose of patience....you'll have a happy belly

xJ4avzFhIL_KPXK2qVAojA.text: The food was absolutely amazing!  I was really impressed with the pancakes in my opinion they are the best in the valley light and fluffy and they had just a hint of lemon.  Even my kids who are really picky eaters happily gobbled up there macaroni and cheese chicken nuggets and pancakes.  My wife ordered a salad and she said it was excellent. I would also want to mention they have fresh squeezed orange juice it was very good and totally worth the $3.75. I would like to give them a perfect five star rating however we went there late on a Sunday afternoon and I found the men's room to be dirtier than expected and therefore I only gave them four stars.

-qCCY6gMgMahTX-Lejpm4A.text: Every time I have family/friend in town I always bring them here! Food is delicious and affordable! One of my favorite spots! The employees are very helpful, sweet, and always with a smile on their faces!

4V2ArA3Jmo47GKcCLaOIqA.text: Great place if you're hungry. Plates are huge, good service, family restaurant. Brioche Cinnamon Roll is soft and good. I had the Gooey Mess Plate....yum. My wife and I split a plate and we still took food home. We live in Chandler, but so worth the drive. We will definitely be back.

6IpD6xw4wb8Q0vOo2V3tsg.text: Great breakfast stop!  Portions are huge and everything tastes homemade. The only reason for a 4 star is coffee was bad.

y4PkLWOQp6eQ__MoezUWtA.text: Great place! Excellent service, breakfast was just okay for the prices. But, we will be back to try something else, burgers sounded good.

X9rJrxRKsfP71ND0z_z7_w.text: This place is AMAZING, been an OBH fan since the beginning and they never disappoint. The food is always fresh and the staff is one of the most friendly staff I've ever met. Whenever we have family in town we always bring them here and they fall in love with the food as well. John sure knows how to run a restaurant and even on busy days once you are seated the food doesn't take long to come out. French toast is by far one of the best I've ever had.

GIHIqpRfU8SjsmZPcrJrEw.text: Enjoyed the crab omelet and the chicken fried chicken! Just discovered this neighborhood gem and will definitely be going back!

csJ4UcEVldp7zIDnNGDo_w.text: The food was pretty good.  The service was great. I had the French toast. I will be returning with the family in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CX83ex5wWoWAzk3EPQsymA.text: OMG - Real people and good food. Incredible choices.  Get the Pecan and Banana Pancakes with the Fresh Squeezed Orange Juice. YUMMY

X8r3a0HC0sFYnKThafZPWw.text: We loved the Original Breakfast House!  The food was so delicious and reasonable priced!  Each of my family members ordered something different ElPaso omelette, Hog Heaven Omelette, Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs, and Fried Eggs with Hashbrowns.  It was delicious!  The staff was helpful and friendly.

GdNItVh2NQCweBleA7a9Zg.text: We have become weekend regulars.  Almost know the menu by heart and look forward to specials that John or Nick come up with.  My favorite breakfast is the Chicken Green tamales with eggs, black beans, warmed tortilla, salsa, guacamole & sour cream.  Hubby enjoys the Chicken Fried Steak, Biscuits &gravy.   Lunch items are just as welcomed to enjoy, no such thing as small portions.   Original Breakfast House is community minded, the Atmosphere is friendly, casual and the wait time always worth it.

UsNUf2Ed3dC1LmRdsukuOA.text: So the lover and I came here for brunch one day. We wanted to try something new.   It was a Sunday, so it was about a 20 minute wait for a table for us two. There were so many good choices on the menu to choose from! I ordered the banana pecan French toast with a side of eggs. This thing was huge!! And so delicious! My fiance got the country fried steak which he enjoyed.  The service was good even though they were busy. I would definitely come back to try some other items on their menu. I just wish they weren't so far. =(

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana pecan french toast with a side of eggs

TllyMfYRGJfbmtvdChLQSw.text: Comfortable atmosphere and quick service and friendly staff.  Cash only and typical breakfast fares.  Looks to have lots of regulars.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7HqrkooBDJFuS2WUQMzKVg.text: The service is the shining star here. Every single employee is rocking a huge smile. The food is superb. Don't miss this spot.

l6jigKQtkLHHldfX-iVyGQ.text: I've been coming here on and off for about 5 years. While the wait can often be a pain, the food is good and service is usually decent. Been awhile since I've been on this side of town so I swung in for breakfast this morning. I wasn't paying my last few trips thru, so I'm not sure how long this cash only policy has been in effect but in short?  I likely wouldn't have noticed (and DEFINITELY wouldn't have cared about) a 10%-15% price hike across the board to offset costs/etc. But to stop taking credit cards? It's 2018. If you can't figure out how to handle cashless payments in this day and age you are not worth the hassle.

iX9gA3K2HMQtKi0c4mJcMQ.text: My favorite breakfast place by far! If it's a Saturday, Sunday, or Holiday it's best to be there early... it gets packed FAST. Which, is always a good sign.   Their two most important aspects are GREAT customer service and even better food.   The manager/owner is always there asking customers how everything is. Employees are always happy. The colors are vibrant and the food is always superb.   Tip: no cards accepted. BUT, free ATM in restaurant. It's not inconvenient.... it's smart.   We bring all of our out of town guests here. Amazing!

JIAEXmIE9R6HbA0xxoX8og.text: New favorite breakfast spot. Super cute and everyone is so friendly. The French toast is to DIE for!

vCiIEyI6PnMdFidA-eer0A.text: Best breakfast in Phoenix.  Only negative is that they don't take credit cards. Check it out, you'll be happy, just bring cash

AJfdZPQAx2SZeXKn6hoY9A.text: I was visiting Phoenix and stumbled onto OBH. The staff were very friendly. The food was delicious. The Guadalajara omelet was fantastic. Their brioche cinnamon roll was awesome. I would recommend it to anyone. They also used and sold "the pepper plant" hot sauces, those are the best in the world.  I highly recommend OBH.

1fF66zlSnMUSjgAEF-Orsg.text: This place is so good! We came here after a race, around 9am on a Saturday morning and only had to wait 15 minutes... but be careful it gets busy! The food was so yummy and they offer a big variety of choices! The French toast was their specialty, and I had the 1 portion of the green chili Benedict. Highly recommend!!

mm4Ko-VgUTCsXz5pwLik1Q.text: Got Sick at Lunch there! I've been there every once in awhile and it seemed to be pretty good just a little overpriced and weak coffee. Well I met a friend there for lunch ordered a Green Chili Burro...it tasted alright ...but got a stomach ache and it went thru me like a freight train. Stick with breakfast if you go!

AA2cQwUQ_Ume1dZSsXoptw.text: I went here after my friend googled brunch places, and it was delicious! Never have I ever , been able to take pancakes home because they were so big and still eat them the next day! Yes the next day! It was a first but if you can do that with the pancakes,  imagine taking any other leftovers home! I had the banana and pecan pancakes and they were so good. My friend had a biscuit and gravy and some type of breakfast taco that she just loved. Long story short, I'll be back! Again and again!

MRcQ46vJHiXCgVlbD7Wb8w.text: I freaking love this place!  I only wish that it wasn't loved by so many other people because it would make it so much easier to get a table here on a saturday/sunday morning.  If you have a chance to come here when the wait isn't hours long do it!  This place has a classic old school diner feel (down to the details of cash only).  Pretty much anything you get here is going to be good.  I personally love the bananas foster french toast.  It's hard to get anything else when I come here but I try to mix it up from time to time and i've never been disappointed.

1seDudyjTk7FAbEpxt7SCA.text: Came in on a Wednesday morning and had an awesome breakfast. Staff was very friendly and attentive, our food came out fairly quickly and the quality of the food was 5 Star. Will be back in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackberry French Toast, Avocado and Shrimp Omelet (special) with Hash browns &amp; Raspberry Chocolate Chip Pancakes, Delicious!

BzBQHDqRLDI3Bc3TiIc3WA.text: We were excited to try this place, and with the outstanding reviews, we fully expected a breakfast treat.  Overall, it was good - some things better than others.  Maybe I need a brain scan or something because the chicken fried chicken really was a disappointment. It was very dry and on the bland side.  The gravy was delicious, and I think if I were to return, I'd give the chicken fried chicken a swerve and instead opt for the biscuits and some of that yummy gravy.  The banana pecan French toast had excellent flavor, and the center of it was light and fluffy. The edges, however, were extraordinarily tough. (It didn't exactly stop me from eating it because it still tasted nicely, but made it a lot more difficult!)  The waffle and regular French toast were tasty, and the coffee was good and hot.  The vibe in this place was great for a Saturday brunch, and the service was stellar.

KmSWWsXjRb7av77olqGaKA.text: First, I think it's important to note that we came with a party of 8 and they were very accommodating. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated. The restaurant was packed but service was incredibly friendly and quick. I normally have very low expectations for breakfast food. I'm vegetarian, from out of town, and picky when it comes to the first meal of the day. I got the Huevos Rancheros Verde with hash browns and I added queso Fresca. My meal was phenomenal, and I dare say one of (if not) THE best breakfasts I've had in my 22 years. The atmosphere of the restaurant is crowded and energetic, but not overwhelming. Bathrooms are single stall. Outdoor waiting area. Cash only, but they have a no-fee atm in case you forget.

-Lnr_l-Kku9PoVUVh91ljA.text: We came here because of all the great reviews. But this place fell very short! We were told 15 minute wait and waited 30..not to big of a deal because we heard it was worth the wait. Well after 45 minutes of waiting for our food and watching the people sat after us and ordered after us receiving their food we just decided to leave. Severely disappointed and do not recommend this place!

x9YeiwIb4L6C4GGEEOV2DA.text: Typical breakfast spot. Basic breakfast with some surf-themed touches - hanging surf boards, surf and beach pics, and servers wearing tie dye shirts.   Service was nice. Coffee was strong. Hubby ordered "The Big Gooey" which was a scramble with eggs, sausage, onions, mushrooms, and large chunks of potatoes. Huge portion but flavor was lacking a bit. I ordered the French Toast Combo with two eggs and bacon. French toast was two large, crispy, amazing looking pieces of bread. I was hoping for a little more flavor to it, like a hint of vanilla, cinnamon or just something to "wow" me.   Because of the great reviews, my husband and I drove 20+ minutes to dine here and also waited outside on their comfy covered patio for a table for about 20-minutes. We both agreed it wasn't worth a drive across town but it was certainly a good, basic breakfast joint.

yLIKU4ocRJZs9sIi5yY4XQ.text: Wow!  The Google search review said it was one of the 10 BEST Breakfast & Brunch in Phoenix.  This was TRUE!  In fact, I felt Buddy the Elf would have Congratulated them on being the BEST.  From the friendly greeter to the sweet and attentive server to the perfectly runny Eggs Benedict, this was a delightful and relaxing experience!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!    NOTE: CASH ONLY--but there is a FREE ATM on site.  Loved the explanation for this on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Place!

U6evt_5wKxY9DPWOOdFG-A.text: This is probably the best breakfast place I have ever been too. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was amazing and the French toast was so good! If you are in the Phoenix area, you have to try this place!

SULBGEkrKJUzkgqPacikXQ.text: Great cinnamon rolls and fresh orange juice! Great place to meet with friends or just for a solo treat!

FAwD0bapgcXb-v9j3oW-CA.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING! Definitely one of the best places to eat in Phoenix! It's very busy & popular but there is comfy seating to wait & it was only 20 min in spite of looking a lot longer due to the crowd. They had a very talented live performer outside to listen to as you waited. Once inside it's mostly a Hawaiian vibe going on & all staff was very friendly, fast & efficient. They know how to get people in & out & do it very well.   The food was the best! We decided on a chorizo burrito & their standard eggs benedict ( they offer 3 different types). The burrito comes wet & was gigantic! Very delicious! What I loved about the eggs benedict was that it was made with prosciutto, which I've now decided ALL eggs benedict should be made with...took it to a whole other level. Chose the hasbrowns with it (which were perfect) but the home fries looked great too (next time). You can also get fruit as a side if you want to keep it healthy. I like to splurge when I eat out.   The whole meal was really perfection & we will definitely be back again. Bring cash, that's all they accept, but have an atm on site if you need it. They serve breakfast & lunch....their breakfast is the best. Don't let the crowd or any wait stop you. It will be worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OBH Eggs Benedict with prosciutto &amp; hasbrowns.
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love that they have stevia &amp; they avoid plastic straws by using ones made from avocado.
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their HUGE chorizo breakfast burrito.

I3WlFbdl7mAdC8iezdk2aQ.text: Location; on Thunderbird and 32nd Street on the Southeast corner - you can't miss it.    Food;  Got the Bacon & Egg breakfast and it plenty of food - everything was cooked to order and so good.  Eggs cooked to order, the potatoes were perfect and had perfect amount of seasoning. The pancakes finished off the meal with a bang. Delicious.   Service;  Danielle was a sweetheart, she had her hands full and still had a smile on her face- always making sure we had hot coffee and satisfied.     Must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x8A5F9uzONalzN6uMuraIA.text: Dined here on a busy Sunday afternoon on Labor day weekend, and waited approximately 20 minutes. There was live music where we were waiting which was a nice touch. The inside of the restaurant reminded me of a mom and pop shop you'd find in Hawaii and it definitely gave me nostalgia.   For food, my boyfriend ordered the lemon curd blueberry pancakes and I had the spam and eggs which also came with banana pecan pancakes (For $9.95, such a great deal). I thought the spam and eggs was just okay - you could never go wrong with spam but the rice wasn't what I expected. On the other hand, the pancakes were delicious. I preferred the banana pecan pancakes over the lemon curd, but it's only because I thought it was too lemon-y.   Our server was absolutely amazing and enthusiastic. I do feel like I ordered the wrong thing and wish I ordered the chicken and french toast or some other sweet dish which seems to be what they're known for. I'm definitely coming back to give it another try.

8z_NWnKUIoHIQ2v0GePzKg.text: Always delicious, great menu, cute atmosphere, clean and comfortable, the OBH is an amazing eatery in North Phoenix.  The building itself has housed many breakfast spots, this one is a welcome addition. Using local produce and proteins is always welcome in any community, OBH does it daily. Their baked items are yummy, fresh and some are thoughtful like the house-made pop tarts! Consistently delicious food is a hallmark of a well run restaurant. The servers are kind, making a nice living in a fun place where management seems to be on point. Oh, cash only to keep costs down passing it on to the customer.  Run!!!! don't walk to OBH :) You can trust me, I'm in the business ;D

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This place is the shit !!

NUvd5WrWCZql1WRYchnGmA.text: We've been here half dozen times @ least. Come early there's always a wait before 11am, but worth it. The have plenty of outside seating & cold waters for you. Very large seating area & good service. The food is always flavorful & quick to come out, kudos to the chefs! Chicken tinga is really good, the pancakes are large & soft. Good portions & decent prices, Homemade sweets too. Cash only, so be ready, there is a free atm.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham n cheese stack
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham and cheese stack
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short stack combo

x62k7scnPLqwrObjz27CaQ.text: Since my review, I've received a lovely response from the business owner.  The sports memorabilia that they sell is to support a local non-profit that helps kids.  This is fantastic, and this kind deed of giving back to the community earns it another star!

FQ-3Vlv-Lq6QdrQTyobzzA.text: Huge portions and delicious food. One reminder, this location only takes cash so be prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffle was great!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Gooey Scramble Mess comes in a huge portion. Delicious!

YEF1zW1bDa4f7kpnhahzWA.text: We chose this place because it was listed in the Phoenix Times 2019 list of Best Breakfast Spots.   We got there around 11:15 on a Sunday, had a 20 minute waited and waited very little but if that time. We didn't realize until we sat down that there's a small bar area that seats about 6-8 people I guess. Be sure to check that out before waiting for a table.   We ordered a glass of fresh pressed OJ, Apple juice and 1 cup of coffee. 1 cup of coffee is 1 pot of coffee by the way. The OJ was sooo good. Apple juice wasn't bad either. For breakfast I ordered the chicken fried chicken special with 1 slice of San Francisco French Toast and 2 scrambled eggs. My partner ordered 3 slices of San Francisco style French toast, a side of chicken sausage, 2 scrambled eggs and hash browns.   Everything taste good but every single thing came out lukewarm, almost cold. Eggs, French toast, everything except for the chicken sausage. We assumed they were waiting for that to cook to bring everything out together. That was a little disappointing and because we waited so long for our food we didn't want to send anything back.   The French toast is tasty, taste just like funnel cake, the had browns were regular and the chicken sausage were pretty good as well. However, they were cut up into little chucks instead of a sausage links, wasn't bad but unexpected.  Original Pancake House is about a 20 min drive from me, not far by I didn't enjoy it enough to go again unless I'm in the area.

iobMv5qZtYnQOvkVMAhozw.text: I ordered a monthly special. The Moco Loco is what I had. It was amazing! The customer service was on point.  Daisy did an amazing job with her customer service! Very friendly and welcoming. I will be coming back next time I am in this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Cc8ULJlMuSExmKleYVDyMg.text: Still doesn't get any better than this place.  After coming for years, the quality of the food is still outstanding, prices are still reasonable, the service is still extraordinary, and the atmosphere is still fun and inviting.  The fresh-squeezed orange juice is the best.  And even better?  You get your first glass, and 1 free refill of the most amazing OJ - for a crazy reasonable price for fresh squeezed OJ - $4.00 for those two glasses!  Speaking of outstanding service, while we were waiting on a Saturday morning (and be prepared for a wait on any Saturday morning), we saw a party of 3 leave after their great breakfast, and out ran a waitress after them carrying to-go containers of their refill of orange juice!  WHO DOES THAT?  Only OBH, that's who.  Today I had the Green Chile Pork Omelette, wife and son split two amazing items - the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, and the Big Gooey Mess (potatoes, sausage, onions, mushrooms and cheddar in a HUGE scramble.)  Son tasted the pancakes, and pushed away the little syrup carafe that comes with it, saying "Mrs. Butterworths, we don't need your help today!"  Everything was delicious as always.  We even got to be served by one of our favorite servers, Andrea - always on top of things, always pleasant, and always hustling.  She's outstanding.  And of course, John stopped by to check in on us toward the end of our meal.  It's a treat to watch him work the room, AND the kitchen, AND the counter, AND the register... this guy sets the tone for OBH, and looks like he's having a blast doing it.  Hope he never retires, but when he does, his son Nick will be there to carry the torch.  Keep it up guys, you're doing it right - you're doing EVERYTHING right!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, and a biscuit sharing the plate
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The amazing Andrea!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Green Chili Omelette (sorry I couldn&#39;t resist digging in before I took the photo)

wfMHRf6o4QU51ys0eqmZpg.text: Never fails to impress.  This institution has their menu down, and does not vary. So nice to know what to expect, and every time it manages to be solid with great service. I always lean towards the chicken fried steak, but when I've gone off from the usual, each time its been great.  Don't let the "cash only" deter you - they do have a "free" ATM - but beware you own financial institution may charge you a fee on their end.  One of these days I want to try their homemade pop tart - I bet its amazing!

k3NikOJ1YGiiqWmqFZEi0Q.text: Know this breakfast place is, oh my God, delicious. so mad that I never listen to my friend in the past. To know that I used to live right around the corner and have never tasted this food does make me a bit angry.  Note to self, bring cash! They do not accept credit cards which help keep their prices down. That being said there is an ATM, so your breakfast could cost you $5 more than it needs to. Be smart, carry cash, enjoy

7rrHyJHpaSjiAGRKVyhVgQ.text: When I walked up to this place on a Sunday morning around 9am there was a guy set up outside playing live music on a keyboard. I'm not sure if this is something that happens all of the time but it should. This place is CASH ONLY and FORTUNATELY they have an ATM machine in there that charges NO FEE!!! I've never heard of that but I love it! Our waitress was super friendly and the establishment is very family friendly. I ordered the special of Pastrami Hash at the cost of about $14.95. The Pastrami Hash came with fried onions on top that tasted stale. They weren't hot, lacked flavor and were somewhat chewy. The dish came with two pancakes which ended up being more than enough. Aside from the fried onions, everything else was delicious. My friend ordered the French toast and she LOVED it! I definitely recommend this place for a good breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami Hash and French Toast Special

voW-BwZCoVwmTNjYjHbQYA.text: My mom and i saw an advertising on the news. The food the reporter was eating looked so delious. So we went the next day. Driving 20 miles was so worth it. Service was excellent. It is a cash only business but no worries. They have an atm inside with no charge. The hot sauce on the table they even sale. It was so good. My mom actually ate all her breakfast!! I will be going back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This hot sauce is so good. I had to buy it.
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The salt and pepper shakers. They r so cute.
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken and eggs. It was so good.

HJ3mFqFLU6eHkd5v278hVg.text: I was in Phoenix on business, with the two owners of my company.  After eating hotel breakfasts for four mornings straight, I needed something real. I had made the decision to go out on my last day, even if my companion decided not to join me.  Thankfully, I did not have to dine alone. We got to the restaurant around 7:30 am.  While my boss parked the car, I went in to snag a table. I waited all of thirty seconds before a friendly man came to seat me. We had been warned by friends the night before, that it could be an hour wait on the weekends. We must've gotten to the restaurant at the perfect time, because when we were leaving there was a group of people lined up outside that were waiting to get in.  The waitstaff was very good to us. They got our food out quick and made sure to refill our drinks whenever they got low.  The portions were larger than we expected.  My boss ordered more than he could handle.  We split (more in his favor) a cinnamon bun...so yummy. He had the grits and finished those off quickly. He also ordered a huge scrambled mess (not the actual name). He only ate half before he began waving the white flag. I chose the Irish Benedict and it was superb!  If you're in town definitely check this place out. If there's a line, go ahead and wait...it's worth it!

E90G3FbOzDzZXZ_63drTmw.text: Service was excellent.  Coffee was very good. Food was really good.  Like the old time diner - family type place.  Not fancy or trendy.  Americana.  I love it.

LU0so8XSy9GXRuuLmozo8A.text: Worth the wait on a weekend morning! All 4 of our meals were incredible...their breakfast potatoes are crispy and well seasoned, the chorizo burrito was nice and spicy, the big breakfast sandwich was gooey, crunchy and delicious, and the s'mores waffle and the tropical stuffed french toast (on special) were delightful. Our server was so kind, bubbly, and attentive. What a great experience! Definitely a top 5 breakfast spot for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores waffle

TpGVm3sOwUoMvlXUwt_cUg.text: My sister and I usually go to the same favorite breakfast spots all of the time. We decided to switch it up because OBH has been in my bookmarks for years! This is our new favorite spot and I am sad we didn't come sooner! The staff is so friendly, and the food is delicious. We tried a little bit of everything - egg white scramble, 1 slice of French toast, 1 biscuit with gravy, side of pancakes ( comes with the egg dish ), and the homestyle fries. Everything was delicious!

melAZgNt29SCr_XLZo3t4A.text: This is my favorite place to have me some good breakfast! Orange juice is freshly squeezed! I've tasted the Huevos Rancheros and the cinnamon roll! It's amazing! My husband got the chilaquiles! Everything is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brioche Cinnamon Rolls

cWLtqCZ5PJM_DUIrntitOg.text: The best part about this place is the reasonably priced fresh squeezed orange juice that also includes one free refill. Haven't found that anywhere yet!  Next up, the unique French toast is phenomenal.  I had to try the house fave with the 2 eggs, chicken friend chicken, and French toast and it was fantastic.  It filled me up for the rest of the day!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z_qwAAyPCkD3EwLa1wnY6Q.text: Very good food and service. Orange juice fresh squeezed and omelette was unbelievable

PE--XiTwLKwlC5fV6arnDg.text: Need to correct my earlier review.  I thought I was on another restaurant.  This place is excellent and we will be back. Friendly courteous service and great food.  Nice selection too...

-4QhtA76h0sFVfgP-AnIig.text: The Friday night fish fry is outrageous! The Fish Fry menu provides several excellent choices and the additional daily specials are very tempting as well.    Last night was my first visit for the fish fry and I wasn't disappointed. I've had breakfast and lunch on many occasions and now I'll make a point of making it to the Friday fish fries. Great restaurant and great staff!

yeuXQRp4VkUxsIm0JO4_pA.text: Great food, friendly service, and a good selection. We went on a Friday late morning and had no wait.

lDNwReSHJjreKCMsTqDluw.text: I have driven past this restaurant so many times, always saying to myself that I should give it a try. Finally did and was glad I did.  The place was packed and more waiting outside. I ordered the special, a lump crab omelet...yum!. I had the pancakes with the omelet and wished I could have finished them. There was just a hint of lemon zest to them...delicious! My friend's meal came with three large slices of bacon and she graciously offered one to me...great stuff! I will definitely return.

T3jpEFKMKPMvHrAKGhZhUQ.text: Authentic old school breakfast house.  Friendly and busy. Genuinely nice staff. Very good food. You should come here and eat.

KS56owI96Un2mznLJA57yw.text: Great waitress,quality food,everything about this place is perfect.Best meal I had in a while.I drove 40 min to have a quality meal and It was worth it that to the oringinal breakfast house

GxssyLNazz_N3dhPXwarCg.text: Great Experience. Wonderfull staff and efficient. Food also tastes very good! Everything was fresh cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Five egg white something like that.. :-)
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elpaso.. really good

qqeOBfKC2WfgcS8L6u_NJw.text: My husband and I live right around the corner from this little gem. Simple and low key place with amazing food! The staff always remembers us and  is very friendly. The Juan's Tacos are absolutely delicious, however, if you're trying to stay healthy the banana crunch oatmeal is great too!

UiphtaVUs8Hu54vGBSguKw.text: We tried this place out this morning. I had the banana pecan pancakes, they were huge. I added eggs and meat. The bacon was a nice cut and the sausage had great flavor. The service was good. I would have liked to have seen corned beef hash and eggs benedict on the menu, but that is just my opinion. Overall it was good and reasonably priced. I am sure we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana pecan pancakes with eggs. Good stuff!

h_kfO8FXEaaERbM8Ga2ZoA.text: Our family absolutely LOVES this place! Great food and great people! My husband enjoys the Chicken Fried Chicken every time. I usually get the Popeye omelette or the deep fried french toast... You can't go wrong with either one. This is the only place we go for breakfast because it is the best. The staff is so nice and up beat, it seems like they are happy to being working there. We have also celebrated birthdays here as well and the complementary French Toast sundae is AMAZING and so worth the extra calories!

_0AX90b56WX4uH7RsGd_ZQ.text: Excellent food and service... Sammy jo ( our server) was awesome, super friendly staff.  San Francisco French toast is a treat.  My friends also loved their meals, Jose tacos, and hue is rancheros... Highly recommended!

FyOveySTtgTUWQij8BTV5w.text: My wife and I frequent the breakfast company frequently the food is excellent and high-end fresh products the homemade jelly is to die for.... great place to take out-of-towne guests

bMJl9r2fSYybC21KY-Er7g.text: Very casual, home feel (as another stated).  The difference between breakfast restaurant's is most evident with the french toast/pancakes/crepes.  OBH has pretty good French toast - and they are big!  Downside is if you want the banana pecan or blackberry versions its a $2 upcharge for very small portion of either item added to the top (its not cooked into or thru) - I'd skip that because the toast is the same otherwise.  I'm a chicken friend chicken and eggs guy so with that menu item titled "FAMOUS" I had fair expectations and asked for extra gravy.  Gravy makes or breaks it.  The chicken was cooked perfectly and good portion (2) - they Gravy broke it though - very flavorless and kinda pasty (my opinion).  They charge $1.50 for extra gravy (they forgot it in my case and I caught it on the bill and it was corrected).  Portions are large.  Service was ok.  The owner has a great video on the site.  The French toast was good enough I'll be back for that and to give this place another shot.  The orange juice is talked about a lot (and that you get 1 refill).  I really wish the Gravy was better as I stated the Chicken was cooked perfectly...  I might give it another shot (maybe the gravy was missing something that day - however the front desk guy said its their special version).

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9edIFCNkmuaTnZZ8rhoWQg.text: Great service, amazing food, good music! The deep fried French toast is literally to die for! More importantly a clean restaurant! -you can tell they take pride in their restaurant from the light fixtures to the shelves, windows, even a peak in the kitchen! Really clean! The service was amazing I can't say enough about Emily, she kept a smile, was very informative & totally on point with her recommendations! Every restaurant could use an Emily :)

5TYfS7BCc6QGPhgc-V4ylw.text: Really high quality food and well prepared. Great coffee and pastries. Breakfast is my favorite meal and this place is now my favorite restaurant.

XubKVlwTssypAS_FUG8d_g.text: My hubby and I tried OBH for the first time today after church and it was terrific. Hubby had the Chicken Fried Steak breakfast and the steak was great. Seasoned perfectly and the gravy was really good. Although my hubby said mine is better, he said it was good. My Strawberry French Toast was very good. The only complaint we might have was that it is very noisy, although in it's defense, it was packed. We definitely will be back.

p6li2UP8Cz6P5Hwqtln02g.text: so so good! so much food that we all loved. I wish I had room to try a MASSIVE cinnamon roll.

FnxbXVDrxqNgxG2VhjU27A.text: Had been wanting to try this spot for awhile and it did not disappoint. The service was efficient and friendly (but not overly, which would have annoyed me), and the food... What can I say? I had the corned beef hash special and it was some if he best I've had throughout the country. My wife's omelette was overflowing with delicious chorizo and was just awesome too. We will return for sure.

AcuuT9GrpSbSYj4Yn-9zgA.text: Wow! Got off an early flight and came here starved. Waited about 20 minutes and totally worth the wait. Huge portions and very yummy. Fresh squeezed OJ. Super friendly and efficient staff. Highly recommend!!

thMUBsqvXx2szISrKAkMDA.text: Can you say Yummy?! I've been here quite a bit & have always forgotten to write a review. ("Not sure why, because this place is awesome!!") The pancakes are one of my fav's. They're always soft & fluffy with a hint of lemon. Sooo good! Another fav is the Popeye Omelette.  Pro tip: It gets pretty busy on the weekend, so phone ahead to put your name on the list if can. Enjoy!

arv7EvFxkjXm72QQRAr8Gw.text: The breakfast here is delicious! The portions are huge, and I always leave stuffed every time I eat here. The pancakes with lemon and blueberries are my absolute favorite!

D1JKzt9syBA3QM4ttTGWUg.text: It rocks. Great old feel. Great pancakes. The specialty ones are on the shareable size. But i enjoyed it

ltmGgGBxZC73hCv6Qn-rtA.text: Searched and searched for a good breakfast place in Phoenix, and this kept coming up on top of everyone's list. It did not disappoint!! I had this incredible fried chicken/french toast combo, and it was incredible. Met up with a friend (we were both visiting Phoenix from out of state) and her two kids, and we ALL loved what we had. Tons of choices, FANTASTIC service (very knowledgeable and friendly server!). Will definitely go back when I'm in Phoenix!

6PPXNYgb1QanNWhZccrT7g.text: Great local breakfast place! Food is fantastic; large portions! Asparagus and goat cheese scramble, garden veggie hash, chicken tinga, and French toast were delicious. OJ is a must buy. It's busy, loud, and crowded on weekends but the food and service are worth it. Before you complain about the cash only part, please read the owner's rationale and then decide whether you support it. (It clearly doesn't seem to keep away the crowds.)

hNpk5_26nynRvMGZZRsgjA.text: Every meal here has been enjoyable and fantastic! Always great service,get there early on weekends... The wait is  comfortable and worthwhile. Gluten-free options are amazing (hear the angels sing)! Love the decor... Only drawback is it gets a bit loud as noise carries well.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

a0Cp5hSZ8H0WZr4xe5ci_Q.text: Best. Place. Ever. I LOVE to eat here all the time. I am becoming a regular because it so delicious and a great place to be with family and friends. I enjoy the chorizo burrito as well as the chilaquiles it's just so amazing to eat such amazing, mouth watering food! I love it! Thank you for an amazing place to go to. It is cash only now but I don't mind especially for the great service and the great amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More and more burritos :D too delicious!!
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious chorizo burrito!! Yummy!!!

DlnIanYz58MvnryY-zwEdA.text: Best food and service in the Scottsdale/Paradise Valley area! A must if you are ever in Phoenix. We went there twice during a conference mini vacation. The fresh squeezed Sunkist orange juice, perfectly cooked eggs, chicken fried chicken, scratch made buttermilk biscuits and sausage gravy - everything on the menu is so good! Best of all is the service!

SObgiYHLR6Ywu8skwvBoxQ.text: Great food, great service, great environment and very affordable for the amount of food you get! It was busy for a Monday morning but well worth the wait and you can tell it's a favorite among regulars and locals so no wonder it was packed. Fair warning it is a cash only place but they have a very convenient ATM with NO FEES which was even better! Definitely recommend this spot!

nA5MVFu1Q4a9xdHxKJ0a_Q.text: I was looking for a new breakfast place to go one day and saw this place on Yelp. So, me and my boyfriend gave it a whirl. When we went we got the green chili pork eggs and chicken fried chicken. It's nice because you can substitute any of there specialty pancakes or french toast instead of toast for like $1.50! We tried a piece of there french toast and chocolate chip raspberry pancakes. The food was so amazing! We liked it so much we went back exactly a week later. It was literally some of the best green chili pork I've ever had, so I got the same thing. My boyfriend tried the big messy scramble and the special pancake for the day which was the cinnamon roll pancakes. Omg, all was amazing again! Plus, the coffee was awesome as well! I'm a one cup girl, I think I had 3! This place is our new favorite for sure!  P.s. Ask for the server Seta or Seda (sorry I forgot the spelling) but she also made the experience wonderful. Very nice, attentive, started conversation, and knew everything about the menu. Just our luck we had her the second time we went as well. She's awesome!

uYKy_yfN4i2PIWcW7sAIQA.text: What a fun place! Clearly a favorite stop for locals, it was crowded on a weekday. The service and food was fantastic.

CcV4sqlyHuDtcRrVV0Unzw.text: Amazing french toast and delish coffee the service was wonderful!!! Visiting from Texas and was very pleased with our choice, we went back again for breakfast the next day!!!

Rdm1JGHkk-LoPOXacCgsjw.text: Best place in Phoenix for breakfast the coffee was great and Chile relleno was delicious

JfG_CWPBb59AkfUgnrR_dA.text: Puts the bomb in bomb-diggity. The French toast was on point and the coffee was just as good. Homestyle cooking with upscale looking food and flavor!  Love this place so it was worth the wait.

bAuqL6iM6AP9zpjaj3B3gw.text: Tradition American food done right.  Just had breakfast there.  Silverware - CLEAN Water -  GOOD no funny tastes. Wait staff - ON THEIR GAME and friendly.  Order came quite fast.  I was surprised to see how busy the place was so late on a tuesday morning,  A testament to the quality of the staff and food.  I had: Chicken Fried Steak, 2 eggs over hard, toast, 2 pancakes.  ALL was cooked perfectly. The toast came with Strawberry Jam they make!  Seasoning was good on all items.  I WILL be back.

kzxB0HBVO0eCYMWAtasIyw.text: We wanted breakfast & I just really wanted to try somewhere different. Checked Yelp and liked the reviews. Bit of a drive from 51st Ave & the 101. Sitting outside waiting to get called, yes waiting, but no worries, well worth the wait! We asked fellow waiters about this place and all gave high praises & shared what their favs are.  I ordered the banana pecan pancakes & hash browns. He ordered biscuits and gravy. Two glasses of the fresh squeezed OJ, took my second to go and coffee. And a brioche cinnamon roll to go as well. :-) Well...everything was so yummy!  The OJ is like sticking your straw right into an orange. Pancakes & hash browns rocked! That cinnamon roll had sooo many layers, now I get the brioche part. Owner, John, on the floor saying Hi & being the dude. Divina our waitress was so sweet, great smile :-) Great breakfast joint! We Will Return Fran G & Phillip B

KwfHpDgz7oU1SfFyNP-ZIA.text: Great food for a great price! Family owned restaurant with great customer service. I go here almost every weekend. Keep it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wn_xTrLMtV0z35QbHA7i3A.text: Great place. Excellent choice. Great pancakes and amazing French toast dessert type toast.

Vs20lzLGLgSvPDLBDQMKbQ.text: Great food at a reasonable price the waitresses were friendly only thing is cash only.

6oMeE3y6bZ5FalwLeDxdsg.text: The people make this place what it is. I'm from CT so I don't know if I'll be back in the area again, but if I am, I will definitely return.

Zn6bTn2gtav5X9NtkepWWg.text: It's a small & busy place, expect to have a long wait time, especially on the weekends (20-30mins) from the pastry side I tried the cinnamon rolls which are  delicious , the server heat them up for us prior to serving I also tried their muffins, they are soft and taste is ok. As main dish we  had the french toast & scrambled eggs. French toast was fried to perfection, very good. Also tried the chicken fried chicken, very well cooked however it needed a little bit of salt. The kids pancakes aren't that special, they taste like the ones you buy frozen and reheat. Squeezed orange juice was very good. The cinnamon rolls pancakes I didn't like, not quite sure what it was but it wasn't what I was expecting. So if you are craving cinnamon rolls I would recommend going straight to the actual cinnamon rolls which are delicious, huge and a very fair price.  Service was great, everyone was nice & friendly. Prices are a little on the higher end compared to other breakfast places around the area.

RcVjirC4LRjEXg9--n9Dig.text: I was craving breakfast and decided to Yelp for a good restaurant,I found this place with good reviews and came to check it out. I got me a coffee,a chorizo and egg taco,and the French toast special. The taco was delicious,I like the French toast but I had better,the coffee was pretty good too. It is a nice place,clean and really good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French toast special
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo and egg taco
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good selection

5oxXUdNBuvdpCXVuKiOjCg.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in the 32 North corridor.  I bring all my out if town visitors here and try to introduce all my friends to this fantastic place as well.      They are very busy on the weekends and you could wait 30-40 minutes for a table.  But once seated, you'll find the wait well worth it.  If You want to avoid the crowds - go for breakfast during the week.  No waiting.     The food is better than most places you'll have breakfast.  While I can't call it gourmet - It's top shelf.  I'm pretty sure most everything is hand made.  Hand dippped vanilla French toast, lightly seasoned breakfast potatoes, and this to die for apple chicken sausage (I crave it when I've been away too long).      Service is always prompt, the food comes out quickly and it tastes divine.  You'll also see the owner here every day - seating people, asking for feedback and just making sure things run smoothly.  Its obvious that he cares and it shows in the staff as well.    I've been here dozens of times and can't think of one bad thing to say - so I figured it was time to write a review.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Original Breakfast house.  Tall ceilings, spacious inside and never overcrowded.

qMBu3Db89JiDnnGSx3YD-g.text: Extremely disappointed. I came here yesterday morning (6-6-16) after an appointment with my 8 year old. After seeing all of the good reviews, I was excited for a hearty, filling, tasty meal. What I got was a waitress who was more interested in everything BUT us, and a bland meal. We were seated quickly, then proceeded to wait (and wait and wait) as our server chatted with a couple in the booth in front of me. I learned that she has been working there for 2 years, she's from Camas Wa, she recommends the french toast, and a few other things. She was not taking an order, as a matter of fact the couple were slowly trying to inch out of the booth and disengage. Finally she came and asked our drink orders. My son got a root beer and I had a coffee and an orange juice. After about another 6 minutes that came out and was dropped off.   Again, we waited and waited while watching her engage and chat with other customers. It took about 15 more minutes for her to come back to take our orders. We placed them and again waited. After another 10-15 minutes, another woman came and dropped off our food. Our waitress was at another table- yep, chatting.  I cut into my carnitas omelette with green chilis. First bite- dry. Very very dry. And bland. Even salt and pepper weren't helping. I took 3 bites and gave up. The potatoes were okay. My son was very happy with his pancakes at least. Oh, and the OJ was delish. Fresh squeezed and sweet.   Anyways, I decided to ask for a box to take the omelette home to my oldest son (AKA the Garbage Disposal). It took another 10 minutes to get that and the check dropped off. By this point I was so done. I took the receipt to the register and got out of there. My oldest son tasted the omelette and tossed it out. He said it was weird tasting and dry- and that boy is not picky, lol.   A few other issues...There were these itty bitty black bugs crawling in and out of the wood window sill, which was dirty. I smooshed a few with my napkin and showed our waitress. No response. The menu was FILTHY and I had both myself and my son go wash up after reading them. (See pictures) I would not go back, nor recommend, sad to say since it's so close to his Dr office.  Edit:  I had a long drawn out response to the owner, but honestly it's not worth it. The waitress was absent, those were not ants, I know what carnitas is, and that omelette was bad.  Sorry, but it is what it is and this is my review. Maybe instead of trying to negate your lower reviews, you could simply say "We've reviewed you post and are looking into it".

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dirty window sill with tiny black bugs. I didn&#39;t even take a pic of the dirtiest part, either =/
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dry, bland, and you can see the chunks of fat. Potatoes were okay.
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filthy menu

5UDZuIDyGmg7lWvIJTdXtQ.text: RESTAURANT CLOSED 7/12/16 to 7/21/16   After reading positive reviews for the Original Breakfast House I was excited to finally try it. Unfortunately we had to change plans as soon as we arrived due to the restaurant being closed from 7/12-7/21 for vacation. Being closed for this length of time you would think the owner would have made the effort to update their voicemail and website.   Very disappointing after making the drive. As we sat in the car looking for other breakfast options we watched over 20 parties walk away just as disappointed, and that was only within 15 minutes.   Note to owner: next time you want to close for almost 10 days to go on vacation, please at least be courteous enough to your existing and new customers to update your voicemail and website accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uR64K1DbBIhLYBbHp9B9Sw.text: O.B.H is the best breakfast joint. Nice healthy servings that helps keep your wallet healthy too. Always a pleasure here. But it isn't a secret! So prepare to wait or arrive early!!

fYJ5XRNMpzSLxvU0G_eW4g.text: Great food you will enjoy i did Nice helpful staff Clean atmosphere Great food assortment I left very satisfied.

dJW-vvxssPM5mqEpsdD_DQ.text: The chicken apple sausage was Fab! My husband loved the chicken fried steak & the sausage gravy was excellent!!! Service was very prompt! The restaurant was hopping -sign of good quality! We will be back next week! Reminder cash only

LxJ63pvgvRVwHZ-ImM6L5g.text: Great service and great people.. food is good and will defiantly be back!! I recommend this place to all! Last time we went it was just a few min wait, always a good place to wait if needed.. they do get a bit busy

H7dLmQaHRc8Q7r4gP4yJwQ.text: All cash but fee free ATM. EXCELLENT SERVICE, clean, interesting menu items in addition to classics. Local ingredients, fair trade coffee. Local crowd. We came on vacation and chose based on ratings - didn't disappoint!

zEIg2pXZsqLtie3sg9W_lA.text: Doesn't get any fresher or home than this  Went with a local, otherwise I would not have known about this desert jewel. Fantastic server gave me the perfect recommendation not on the menu. Bacon, asparagus, feta omlett. Then I saw a giant cinnamon roll come to the next table. Too full to get that too. I'll be back on my next visit just for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bieXu47Z3zwitOMVhLwwiw.text: The food here is great. Came here with a friend for Friday brunch and it did not disappoint. It has a nice little mom and pop vibe to it that creates a very welcoming atmosphere. They serve their ice coffee in a root beer mug that they constantly refill, it turns out to being a lot of coffee throughout the course of the meal. My friend got the lemon custard pancakes and I got their country fried chicken special. The portions here are incredibly generous and I would be surprised if most people could finish all their food. In fact I didn't see anyone around me that did.   There was a bit of confusion when I ordered actually and I thought the fried chicken came with their hashbrowns, which look and smell amazing. I'm glad I didn't get the hashbrowns because I would not have been able to eat them at all.   I would highly recommend Original Breakfast House. Definitely one of the better breakfast diners north of Phoenix!

8lZrSRXOseJweoFCST5e6A.text: Bummed. So many good reviews so I had high expectations. We ordered the El Paso omelet (chorizo,beans,peppers,onions), the raspberry chocolate pancakes, and the fried chicken/french toast. Orange juice to drink.  Pros:  Excellent orange juice  Friendly service French toast was delicious  Cons:  Omelette was terrible. Nothing is cooked into the eggs, rather scooped in. This caused a soggy omelette. Chorizo seemed like seasoned ground beef. Proportions of filling to egg was completely off. My guess is canned beans and peppers. I would have sent it back if the waitress had come by.   Pancakes looked great in the menu but did not live up to the picture. Not fluffy nor flavorful.   Fried chicken was chewy. Flavor was not bad but it was tough.   I really wanted to love this place as so many have before. I don't know if they were having an off morning or if this is standard.

zA89oY34J0ZjET38Jf3hDA.text: One of the best places for breakfast in town.  Great food and accommodating staff.  Vegan options and a flexible kitchen staff that is willing to adjust ingredients to account for differing dietary needs.

2S_tKV5qO-S0TWrSgMpung.text: The hostess and wait staff were gracious and attentive. I had two eggs and bacon which were cooke perfectly but they were a side to the main attraction. I also had blueberry pancakes with lemon curd. What a great change for mornings flapjacks. The blueberries, lemon curd spread, and maple syrup were brilliant together. This was a great breakfast experience.

6RR-DtaAyMxT4YtzNkeqpA.text: Fresh squeezed Orange juice, good food, good menu packed on Sunday nice place Family Owned I'm sure all eat here again

photos.caption: Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Original Breakfast House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xmHgN_PlSkfdOdACLxnODQ.text: Awesome same like always food is great awesome hospitality and good energy in original Breakfast House I love it

j_5hOjS5fjGtlz2M46Hsjw.text: Went to the Original Breakfast House on a Saturday Morning and it was packed but had to only wait 10 minutes.  The people were very friendly and helpful on assuring everything was right.  We shared the San Francisco Style French Toast, Banana Pecan Pancakes which we ordered with Eggs and Sausage or Bacon. We also had the Hash Browns.  The French Toast was a San Francisco Sour Dough Bread and prepared very well. It taste better than it looks :)  The Banana Pecan Pancakes are fluffy and soft but very filling. The have a very good taste and a touch of lemon.  The Hash Browns are prepared just right with a outer crisp that I like.  The restaurant it's self is not in a great area and the building is not new skills don't expect like a Scottsdale Style Foo Foo Restaurant because it is not going to be here.  Come for the food, will come back to try other items maybe some of the Mexican Breakfast Dishes
